She is now a student at a prestigious art college and uses it a lot; her professor and other students have admired it and also feel that she made a good choice.Would definitely recommend.  Also got an extra lens and a very nice case for it, which I recommend as well especially if this is to be a gift.  An expensive camera like this needs to be protected.  :)Update July 2013:  My daughter has now owned this camera for slightly more than one year, and it will no longer charge.  There's no telling if it's the battery, the batter charger, or the camera itself; but after paying $1000 (by the time we added accessories) and being told this would be the last camera I'd ever need to buy, I'm VERY disappointed.  Especially in Nikon!  I called them, and they could have cared less.  They flatly stated that the one-year warranty has expired, but that the battery wasn't covered under the warranty anyway.  Their suggestion:  send the whole thing back for a repair estimate, or purchase a new battery, end of story.  Not even an apology (although they did send me a feedback form, which I intend to fill out and return).  They spent more time collecting my personal information on the phone call then they did with suggestions on what to do.I think this is yet another example of a good name brand letting their quality go downhill.  Sign of the times, I'm afraid.Now wish I had purchased the Canon.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: David Baek
Reviews.Content: Recently upgraded from D40. Main use for my kids pics. I'm not a beginner but fairly comfortable with all the manual settings on a DSLR. So far very satisfied with quality of pictures, ease of use and size (didn't want to get something too big). Since I was familiar with D40, it didn't take long before I figured out many of the functions.

Reviews.Title: A Nikon Success
Reviews.Author: david E
Reviews.Content: This Nikon d5100 does exactly what it says on the box, I am not a photographic genius, but if you take time to read all the instuctions, which are set out in a easy to understand manner, you will soon be able to take in my view great pictures.  The camera comes with all the leads, chargers, nessessary to take instant pictures, with one exception it does not come with a basic memory card without which you cannot use the camera!Apart from that another great NIKON this is my 3rd,the other two being 35mm. I would say this mid priced camera is ideal for people like me who like to take good pictures,but are not camera buffs!

Reviews.Title: Plug and Play...
Reviews.Author: John Yoga
Reviews.Content: Folks,You can leave this on the AUTO setting, and the pictures look great. I either leave it on this setting or put it on the P setting, and leave the settings at: White Balance: Auto > OK > A2; Set Picture Control: SD > OK > Sharpening: 7, Saturation: +1; Active D-Lighting: Extra High. Leave everything else as default/AUTO. These settings seem to beat the AUTO settings, especially when taking lower light/indoor photos. This could simply be a personal preference, though. Sometimes also putting on HDR (settings: default), on top of what I've set above also helps when you notice very high light-dark (light contrast) shots in front of you.The only issue I see is that this camera tends to massively increase the ISO (1500-3000+) in slightly lower lighting conditions, when it is not needing to do so. Put it on P (or M, A, S),and the camera does not reach for those crazy-high ISO settings; you can bound the ISO Auto setting's lowest & highest numbers.Also, I have seen no/extremely little noise, with photos, even when I magnify them, when the ISO is upwards of 800-1000 levels; you get above these levels, and you begin to see increasing levels of noise, but only if you crop/magnify the picture 150%+.The only complaints I have are that it eats through the battery charge, even when not in live mode, and, if you want (and should) buy a secondary battery, they are very expensive!Great camera!MarcP.S. Folks, what P (or M, A, S) settings do you like?

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Picture Quality; Great High ISO performance
Reviews.Author: Ralph "Ralph"
Reviews.Content: I sold my D3100 and purchased the D5100.  I really liked my D3100, but there are 2 features I wanted that the D5100 has:  1.) bracketing function and 2.) ISO 1/3 increments.  I like HDR photography, and the 3 exposure bracketing mode makes it easier to do on the D5100 (although I wish it had a 5 exposure bracketing mode).  I take a lot of night photos, and the D3100 would only go from 800 to 1600 to 3200.  The D5100 will let you shoot at ISO 1000, 1250, 2000, etc.  The high ISO performance on the D3100 is very good, but it is outstanding/phenomenal on the D5100.  I have taken quite a few ISO 5000 and 6400 photos on the D5100 that come out awesome with almost no noise, even with the stock lens.  I recently took a photo at ISO 5000 and posted on flickr that looks like ISO 200 on almost any other camera I have ever used, including my Panasonic GH1.  I will share it on Amazon.  I believe the incredible low light, high ISO performance is because the D5100 shares the same sensor as the D7000.  So this is a big upgrade from the D3100 as far as the sensor in low light environments.  I have taken about 500 photos so far, and pictures come out tack sharp with the stock lens.  Combined with the 35 mm F1.8 Nikon lens, the camera takes as fantastic of pictures as I could possibly imagine.  Battery life is incredible--after 500 pics the battery indicator still showed the full 3 bars.  I also like the adjustable swivel screen for when I am shooting on a tripod or above my head.  The one thing I do not like about the camera are the placement of the buttons and settings.  There is not a button for ISO; you have to press the "i" button then scroll down on the screen and change it.  You could assign ISO to the Fn button (which is in a difficult location on the left side of the camera), but then you can't set the camera to a 2 second self-timer without going through the menu.  I use the 2 second timer a lot for shooting on a tripod at night, so I didn't change the Fn button.  On the D3100, the self timer was on a switch on the top; not sure why they removed that.  Overall the controls are somewhat cumbersome in the dark without looking at the camera.  I am getting used to them, but they could make it easier.  Finally, the D5100 does not autofocus on older Nikon lenses like the D7000 does.  But I think the picture quality of the D5100 is probably equal to the D7000 because they use the same sensor.  Other than the controls/button placement issue, I love this camera and highly recommend it.  I think it is certainly worth the 200 dollars more than the D3100 if you are considering between the 2.

Reviews.Title: Wows me every time I press the shutter button
Reviews.Author: Gabriel Young
Reviews.Content: Let me first say that this is my first DSLR. I take about 10,000 pictures a year and I figured it's time for me to upgrade to a decent SLR.I always cringed at SLRs since I never want the burden of carrying it around. I figured that a camera wouldn't do me any good if didn't want to take it anywhere. That being said, although I still use a very nice point-and-shoot for many quick trips with my kids, for birthday parties and other big events, I want the crispest, most colorful, pictures I can take. Here's why I love this camera:-PICTURES-Since it uses the same sensor as the Nikon D7000, which costs significantly more, the pictures are incredible for its class. You literally cannot buy a camera that takes better pictures at this price point. Compared with the Canon T3i, which is a direct competitor, I believe these pictures are better indoors and in low light. Also, a quick tip: for most pics, JPEG basic setting (~400kb) is fine for 4x6 and JPEG normal setting (~1mb) is fine for 8x10.-VIDEO-I don't use this for video often but it captures HD video. I prefer to use an HD camcorder for video but from time to time when I only have this, I'll take a few short vids and they look great.-SIZE/FORM-The Nikon D5100's body is slightly smaller than the Canon T3i's. Although my hands are on the larger side, I prefer the smaller body and it fits well. I use Opteka Professional Wrist Grip Strap for Digital & Film SLR Cameras with the camera and it feels like it's an extension of my hand. A side note: If you choose that hand strap, you'll need to cut a notch off the bottom to allow you to swing the screen out (I have a review there that details how I got that hand strap to work for me).-SPECIAL FEATURES (HARDWARE)-A 3" swing out screen! That's what initially led me to choose the D5100 over the D3100. This is great to capture different angles and ideal for self-shots that I take with my kids. As a bonus, you can also "close" the screen to protect it if you're going to use the viewfinder. Of course, now that I have this model, I'm thrilled that I have better pictures.-SPECIAL FEATURES (SOFTWARE)-Lots of special effects on here! My kids love the Selective Color (B&W; pic with a color highlight) and Color Sketch (cartoonish look) options. Personally, I use High Key a lot for dark situations when I don't want to use the flash. After the shot, I also occasionally crop the pics right on the camera.-USER-FRIENDLINESS-I consider myself slightly more knowledgeable than a beginner but I can even set it up for my wife to use. Simply use as many or as few of the features as you need. If you're ready to learn, the Nikon D5100 is an amazing, somewhat intuitive tool.-RECOMMENDATION-If you can afford it, the Nikon D5100 is a great high-end starter camera. You will grow into it and for the majority of us (non-pros), this will be more than adequate for our needs for the long term so you won't need to upgrade to another SLR. My only regret is that I didn't have this when each of my kids were born!

Reviews.Title: Outstanding DSLR
Reviews.Author: Inra reviews
Reviews.Content: This is an outstanding DSLR camera and picture quality is tooooooooooooooo good.Always pair this with Nikkor lens for good performance. I got 18-200 and it is superb.

Reviews.Title: Forget about the D3100. Get this camera instead!
Reviews.Author: Chris Blount
Reviews.Content: I first got the D3100 and used it for a few days but soon discovered its limitations. 1080p video on the D3100 was horrible and had lots of "jelly" artifacts. The D3100 also has a lower resolutions screen and no HDR.The D5100 is a much better camera with features worth the extra $300 over the D3100. Having built-in HDR is a big plus for high contrast shots. 1080p video is just as good (if not better) than any dedicated HD camcorder. The higher resolution screen makes it much easier to evaluate shots. Being able to swivel the screen is also a major upgrade especially when you are trying to shoot at wierd angles. The in-camera special effects can be called "gimmicky" but they really are fun to use and will spice up any photos.If you are going to spend $600 on the D3100 you might as well bump that up to $900 for the D5100. You will be happy you did because in the long run you will not only have a fantastic DSLR, but a really top notch HD video camera.

Reviews.Title: Could not be Happier!!!
Reviews.Author: James Higgins
Reviews.Content: I am a first time buyer from Amazon and had a-lot of reservations buying a "used" camera from anyone, especially someone I could not get my hands on. To my delight the camera arrived in the original box with everything perfect.  I'm having problems putting it down, it was everything I expected and more.Thank-you Amazon!!!Jim Higgins

Reviews.Title: Wonderful Camera!
Reviews.Author: Craig
Reviews.Content: It almost can't take a bad picture! I have renewed my love of photography with the Nikon D5100 from when I used a completely manual Pentax 35mm in high school when the Manual setting was all you had; setting your own f-stop, shutter speed, flash distance, etc. This camera does it all, but I prefer to use either A, S or flat out M to get the shot I want. The kit lens is pretty standard but excellent. Great  for those kids or pet shots around the house, snap shots of family and events. Found this on Amazon on a Christmas sale for $75 less than the D3100 that I had my eye on at Best Buy. (That's a $250 price reductions!!) Merry Christmas to me!!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: K. Hollingsworth "retiresumday"
Reviews.Content: Fantastic camera and my son who I purchased it for absolutely loves it!  A ton of features he'll probably never ever realize how to use but, that's up to him!

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera with great low light results!
Reviews.Author: Ram "ramprasad1980"
Reviews.Content: The camera at this price ($469) is a steal. I would advice anyone to get the body only and purchase the Nikkor 35mm 1.8G prime lens. I am a beginner and i discovered my passion for photography with is camera.

Reviews.Title: Best DSLR for your money right now.
Reviews.Author: Perry M. Rogers
Reviews.Content: This camera really is great. I am writing this after using a Nikon D3100, Nikon D5200, and Canon Rebel T3i.There is a huge gap between the D5000 and D5100, but very little between the D5100 and D5200 or D5300.The D5100 feels like it has a better grip than the other two because they are a little smaller.I use this camera to take long exposure star pictures, and while it doesnt compare to the D600 or D4, it still has relatively low noise for how cheap it is. I found there was even more noise in the D5200.The articulating back screen is probably the best thing about this camera compared to the D3100 or D3200. You think you wont need it, but when you have it, you wont know how you lived without it.If you're looking for a camera for the budding photographer, go with this camera or the D5300 if you have the money. The D3100 and D3200 are full of megapixels, but that wont matter if you cant take a good picture first.  The lenses are the most important thing when it comes to photography.

Reviews.Title: The wife loves it!
Reviews.Author: Bryan G Carter
Reviews.Content: Got this camera for my wife for Christmas.  Nailed it!  10 cameras and we finally found the right one! We are both novice users and still manage to take professional (to me anyway) quality pics with it.  For the amateurs out there scared to pull the trigger because you cant decide, you WILL be happy with this camera and you will notice a big improvement over the normal point and shoots you have been using.  Don't be intimidated by all the features, it is very intuitive.  For the experts out there, you may disagree, but then again you should have stopped reading this review when I said I was a novice.

Reviews.Title: requires study and patience but well worth it
Reviews.Author: AoiElf "spreading the good word of anime"
Reviews.Content: This was my graduation present to myself; I had always wanted a dSLR.  It is a great price for what you get, and you would not beleive the quality difference in point and shoot and DSLRs. Way worth the price.  The shutter speed is amazing as well, and, with a DSLR, you get to purchase different lenses for what  you need.

Reviews.Title: A great first DSLR camera!!
Reviews.Author: Justin Thomas "Justin Thomas"
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera. The auto mode makes anyone look like a professional photographer. Switch to manual mode to get some great shots and use your creativity. Get a few lenses and you will be very happy with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Couldn't be happier
Reviews.Author: Ben Schnell
Reviews.Content: This camera has been ideal for sporting events.  Easy to use and I love the ease in switching in and out of video mode.

Reviews.Title: Finally good pictures of the kids
Reviews.Author: AnneInTX
Reviews.Content: After a year of taking crappy pictures of the kids with a pocket digital, where shutter lag made me crazy, I am so glad I finally spent the money and got this camera.  It actually takes the photo when I press the button!  I was able to get great action shots of my son at the bike rodeo, using my 55-200 lens, and they are wonderful!  The standard lens that comes with it (18-55) works fine for photos around the house and outside.

Reviews.Title: Great Beginner Camera
Reviews.Author: Nicole
Reviews.Content: I got this camera in December 2012 so I've had it for almost a year now. I started out with a point and shoot, A canon powershot sx230. So of course this was a big step up. But I played with other cameras and made my decision after a lot of reading etc. I love this camera, for what it is and the price. I haven't had any issues with it yet. You get the same sensor as the more expensive D7000, just a cheaper body. I got a few months ago the Nikkor AF-S50mm 1.8G. I don't even use the kit lens that it came with anymore really, except for some wider shots of a room or something. The Glass is what makes the difference! If you're a beginner and deciding between this and the D7000 or one of the more expensive ones. I say get this, save your money and buy a better lens because that is the big difference in image quality. I'm saving up for more lenses and then will get a new body in a few years when needed but invest in glass is what I have to say! Overall, I have to just say this is a great camera and I would highly recommend it.(Also make sure to get Adobe Lightroom for your photos.)

Reviews.Title: Just what I expected.
Reviews.Author: Caroline Connors
Reviews.Content: A definite step up from my D40.  I'm glad I decided to go with the D5100.  I took it on a trip to Rome and was very pleased.

Reviews.Title: Very nice product
Reviews.Author: Chef Ricardo Ibarra
Reviews.Content: I bought this product that said used like new,  but it's actually refurbished, which is quite nice but cause I know for a fact that big companies like nikon have very good refurbished items, it actually looks exactly like the brand new item but costs 150 bucks less,  so I definitely recommend it, it takes awesome pictures and very easy to use.

Reviews.Title: I love It!!
Reviews.Author: Nekoro "Nekoro"
Reviews.Content: i just plainly love it. It paid back for itself ten times over. The picture quality is amazing. I would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful camera
Reviews.Author: Stealthy "Sam"
Reviews.Content: This camera has done everything I've needed it to do and more. Very sturdy, very durable, very practical to carry and transport. Photos are clear, with plenty of features for everyone - from the beginning photographer to the experienced artist. Excellent value for the price, and you've got to love Nikon's quality and reliability. The battery lasts a considerable amount of time, but it's always good to have a spare - especially if you love to snap as many pictures as I do.

Reviews.Title: Better than expected
Reviews.Author: christine Stonebraker
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera mainly because I wanted a camera that was significantly better than my Casio Exilim. Although this option was not advertised, I have enjoyed the option to have auto OR manual focus. I'm definitely not a pro at photography, so I don't know how this camera would measure up to professional standards, but for me, it's been wonderful! It also has a lot of cool built-in filters and options that help make a good photo a great one. Lastly, it's very easy to attach/detach lenses. I would highly recommend this camera to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Beginning photagrapher
Reviews.Author: Jesse David Wintergerst
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased this as a a gift for my wife (and also because I wanted it, hehe). It's a great buy for the price, and also is a good camera to start with if you are an amateur photographer like I am. Easy to use, and learning to play with the settings is pretty cool once you realize you can't really mess things up (permanently, anyway). My brother takes a lot of prfessional photos, so he has been a huge help learning with this. It arrived in good condition wth the battery already charged, so it was pretty much ready to go out of the box. For sure would reccommend it for someone looking to get into taking pictures as a hobby or for family photos.

Reviews.Title: Once again
Reviews.Author: Southern Cookie "SC"
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I have purchased this camera. I liked the first one so much I got another to give as a gift. This camera is easy to start using and it has a huge array of "How To" manuals/books available that are specific to this Nikon model. I believe others have covered all the specs and technical details, GPS and WiFi capabilities were not essential to us. We have dedicated video cameras. Great pictures are why we own this camera.  The articulated screen is incredibly useful for overhead shots, ground level shots and everything in between. It allows me to carry a smaller travel tripod and still easily see what I am shooting while standing upright. The D5100 has several cost/buying options that make it affordable. The fact that I have purchased yet another for a loved one is all I can add to this outstanding camera.

Reviews.Title: Great camera with lots of great features.
Reviews.Author: Mary
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my sister and it's a great camera. We are both beginners but I think it matters if you know your way around electronics. It's fairly easy for those who know their way. It takes stunning pictures, very professional looking pictures. It has a few scene modes which are great. The zoom goings up to 55 mm, and is okay but not that great. The pictures still come out amazing at the highest zoom. I'd advise anyone who buys this camera to buy a good carrying bag and to purchase a Class 10 memory card. I tried recording video with an SD card from another camera but it cut off after a few seconds.

Reviews.Title: Worth every penny.
Reviews.Author: El-Kabong
Reviews.Content: I don't know a damn thing about photography but now I'm "kick-ass" with a camera!I'm still learning how to use the more complex features but I would have bought this a long time ago if I had any clue about how freaking awesome it is. I've captured hawks in-flight, breathtaking scenery and incredible up close details.The one challenge I have is auto focusing the spit second before taking an action shot, and maintaining the focus during multi frame per second pictures.  You know? When I see the shot gotta take it but no time to focus gott shooot when the moment is  hot!

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Jamie D
Reviews.Content: Love this camera. It's my first DSLR. It takes a bit to get used to since there a lot of controls and stuff you can do but you can get some awesome pictures. I'm still learning more about all the manual modes, but I've gotten better at my picture taking with this camera. It's helped me a lot. If you're more of a beginner photographer, this camera will be great for you. I don't think you need to spend $1,000 or more on a camera when this one is perfect enough.

Reviews.Title: Really good!
Reviews.Author: @jh_sanchez
Reviews.Content: For a semi professional DSLR camera this is just awesome. Easy to use for a beginner user like me. Extremely recommended for everybody.

Reviews.Title: Better than the D3200
Reviews.Author: redmatrix06 "retrogamer"
Reviews.Content: This was my first time shopping around for a nice entry level DSLR camera.  I have had a 7 year old point and shoot camera.  I was deciding to go with the D3200 but a photography hobbyist friend mentioned and recommended me this camera over the D3200.  The price was a 100 bucks less but was only for the body.  I purchased a Sigma 18-200 lens and love my new camera.  Cant go wrong.

Reviews.Title: Love, love, LOVE this camera
Reviews.Author: Steven Blount
Reviews.Content: I had a traditional (film) SLR thru college right up until last year. I'm not a brilliant photographer, but I took some amazing photos with it. This Nikon is sure to up my game. It's amazingly easy to use, lightweight and it looks cool. I added a 35 mm lens and a 300 mm zoom to my kit shortly after purchasing this bad boy and, although I haven't had much to shoot yet (it's a drab, dreary winter here), I'm looking forward to really testing its chop. But, so far, I have no complaints. The controls are intuitive and easy to use. Delivery was bang on schedule and no defects I've detected. Highly recommended for those just starting out in DSLR photography but don't want "beginner" gear. I imagine I'll eventually upgrade, but I don't envision outgrowing this camera any time soon.

Reviews.Title: Excelent!
Reviews.Author: Ileana
Reviews.Content: This was a gift for my son, now he's so happy with it... It's big, but not too much, the quality of the images is amazing, I would say this is the perfect camara for a begginer.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic camera, great for most people
Reviews.Author: J. Michelle Pakron "Michelle"
Reviews.Content: I have had the D5100 for well over a year now and it is a great camera and was a big jump in image quality and features over my D50. The images it produces are gorgeous. I bought a d200, which in its time was a great camera, on ebay recently and compared shots from it, a semi pro model, to the 5100, and the 5100 kicked its butt. The 5100 has much better image quality and does a way better job in low light over the D200. I do prefer the size of my D50 to the 5100, though I have big bear hands so maybe that's the reason. The 5100 also lacks an internal focusing motor, so several of my lenses that work fine on my D50 will only work in manual mode on the 5100, which wouldn't be a big deal except i find going into manual mode much easier and faster on the D50 than the 5100. I think that is on purpose as the 5100 is more of a consumer camera vs an enthusiast or semi pro camera. Full disclosure: I just bought the new D7100 and flippin love it. I upgraded because I want a more robust body and faster autofocus and faster period, and the D7100 does all that. But the 5100 is still an awesome camera for the majority of folks and i highly recommend as a shooters first or second DSLR. Put a good piece of glass on it, like the 1.8 35mm and get the cheap SB-400 flash, and you will be amazed at the quality of your photos.

Reviews.Title: Your memories are priceless
Reviews.Author: D. Maarek
Reviews.Content: The picture quality of the D7000 for a much more affordable price.Our pictures are our memories and they are priceless, no one would differ on that.If your budget is limited (as it always is) it is absolutely a better consideration to invest in picture quality than in functionality.And this camera gives one of the best compromise price vs picture quality.You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: LS
Reviews.Content: Great camera, fast, responsive, fantastic image quality even in low light. Great camera for a newbie who plans on expanding into manual options. Swivel screen is great too.Video mode works great and it starts almost instantly.I ordered a "used" model but they actually sent me a refurbished model so that was nice. No scuffs or anything, looks brand new

Reviews.Title: Ich liebe es (I'm loving it)
Reviews.Author: Bruce George Jr. "Bruce!"
Reviews.Content: I have always loved photography. I started out with a 8mp Sanyo. It lasted for a while and once I started to get a little income, I told myself that I will have a DSLR. Done my research for a while. I was looking at Canon, but Nikon was the first I went in depth to. Bought my 5100 Wednesday Nov 16th 2012. I bought the bundle and with my discount, it was even cheaper. Elated was not the word to describe me that day because those who know me at my job knew it was all I talked about and I worked my tail off as well. Saved every penny and did not spend haphazardly. Once I got home, I charged up my camera and just like any newbie, I took pictures of random stuff and did not read the instructions. As a result, my photos did not come out good starting out. At the time, I was not familiar with the jargon like I am now. After going through my camera and figuring everything out, the quality of my photos are amazing. As any entry level DSLR's, you get what you pay for as well. Focusing is an issue, which I am sure many of you experience. Taking photos at low light as well. I do not like using my flash unless I have to... I have three batteries, two which are aftermarket brands and I have not used the original in a while. With that being said, I have never been happier with my purchase. Looking to get the D7000 in the summer and will call it quits.  The 5100 is great to start out with. It is very user friendly and overall, it is just awesome. You have to play with the camera and test it in all settings.

Reviews.Title: Very nice camera
Reviews.Author: Jeff Sluder "Fishing bum"
Reviews.Content: Wow, this is a nice camera.  I'm an old film camera guy.  I always used Nikon cameras and glass for my photography.  I'm really impressed with how sharp the photos are, the depth of color and the quality of the overall outfit.  Even the "kit" lens is really good.  I would have no problem recomending this to a friend.

Reviews.Title: for the money, this is probably best bang for the buck
Reviews.Author: Kerry Pierce "kerrypierce"
Reviews.Content: I'm a long time (over 8 years) Nikon DSLR user, primarily using pro and semi-pro bodies. My main body now is the D3s. So, when I bought the d5100, I was ready to be disappointed.Well, I've had the camera for a couple of months now and I must say that the little camera is a keeper. The images that it can produce are about as good as one could ask for, assuming that the photographer does his part. I'm not a big fan of having to use the menu on so many oft-used parameters, but Nikon fixed much of that with being able to see and change all of that stuff on the LCD. Yes, I still prefer the dedicated screens and buttons that one finds on the pro level bodies, but that's part of why they cost so much.For general photography on a budget, I just don't see how one could need more than what the d5100 offers.  I am delighted with this little camera, especially due to the excellent images, and Live View with the swivel screen is simply terrific for use on most any difficult subject.The d7000 is another excellent camera that I own and have used this year, but I must give the d5100 my Best Bang for the Buck award. IMO, you can't hardly go wrong with this camera as a budget camera to carry around all of the time.

Reviews.Title: Worthwhile upgrade from the D5000
Reviews.Author: W. Ivey
Reviews.Content: I've used a Nikon D5000 for a few years and loved it but I took notice of this one when it first came out and thought I would upgrade, mostly for things like in-camera HDR and, esp., the higher resolution LCD. Thought about it for a year and a couple of weeks ago decided to go for it. (Something about impending holidays triggers the camera buying urge.) Since I had all the lenses I needed I bought the body only, saving about $100 over the kit price.As expected, it was a great upgrade. What I wasn't expecting was the improvement in full auto mode. I'm able to take decent photos now under conditions the D5000 complained about or didn't do well in. Since I take more photos in full auto mode than not, this is a nice bonus. (I'm not adverse to fussing with shutter speed, aperture, etc., and you can certainly do that all you want with this camera, but I take a lot of casual photos.)If I were buying this as my first Nikon I'd probably buy the body and pay a couple of hundred extra for the 18-105 mm zoom rather than get the kit with the 18-55 zoom. It's a better walking around lens in my opinion. I might also buy the 35mm f1.8 prime lens for low light/indoor shots (or extra crispy shots of any kind). Those were the two lenses I bought when I got my D5000 and I use them the most. (Another useful lens that's reasonably priced is the Tokina 12-24 f4 zoom.)The only (minor) complaint I have is that my non-Nikon TTL flash unit doesn't work properly with the D5100. I get badly overexposed shots with anything other than straight-up, off the ceiling bounce. Probably time to look at getting a real Nikon flash unit.Update on the flash unit problem. My Polaroid brand TTL flash and the D5100's full auto setting don't get along. It works fine in Program mode, though. On the D5000 it worked in either mode, but apparently there is a subtle difference in the D5100 interface. The flash tracks the zoom and aperture, but either the flash is firing at full power or the camera's auto mode is not aware the flash is going to fire and sets up for available light. Newer Polaroid flash units than mine might work better with the D5100.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Camera
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Todd A Mead"
Reviews.Content: I have had several high quality consumer cameras over the past 10 years or more.  This is my first what I would call a semi-professional camera.  It is amazing.  The quality of the photo is fantastic.  I have been using a Cannon Power Shot S3IS for the past few years.  It is a nice camera but not on the same level as the D5100.  The D5100 has a much higher Megapixel count which improves the image by itself, but the photo processing is also greatly improved.  The D5100 has many scenes and effect modes that helps the amateur (that would be me:)) take great shots right out of the box.  After a little reading I have started experimenting with the professional settings and have had great results.  This camera is making me a super photographer.If you are looking for an affordable, high powered, super DSLR camera, look no further.

Reviews.Title: Best camera for a Photography Entusiast
Reviews.Author: Santiago Sack
Reviews.Content: I own this camera for about 1 month and its great! Easy to use, and with lots of features to play with. You can't ask more for that price, and its got the same sensor as the D7000.The grip is soft and well fitted to your hand. Its a little small, but you can get a battery grip at amazon for a low price. The battery life is excellent, i suggest you pick up another one if you are a travel photographer.this camera its absolutely what i needed for...i hope to get another model in a few years.

Reviews.Title: I LOVE my Camera.
Reviews.Author: Denise D. Mcknight "msworld500"
Reviews.Content: My husband bought us this Camera for a present for me, maybe it was our Anniversary.  ANyway, it takes great pictures, I just want to get a new lenses to get even closer shots.  Took some action ones of our son, and it works great.  Highly recommend.  Thank you Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Best Price, Best Buy and Best Nikon anywhere
Reviews.Author: Noah Williams
Reviews.Content: It does everything I want plus some. like the live view and dedicated record button. The flip open LCD keeps my screen clean and protected you can't find that on any other camera. You have to purchase a protective cover BUT not for this camera.Was kinda shocked it was so small. for girly hands that I don't have. That's why I bout the extra battery grip.

Reviews.Title: Upgraded from my D40x and I love this camera!!
Reviews.Author: Robert
Reviews.Content: This camera is great! I'm always on a budget and this one fits the bill perfectly. I loved my D40x, but unfortunately, it's seen it's time and I had to get a replacement. This is a great entry-level DSLR. Very affordable which gives me more spending money on lenses. I'm not a professional photographer, this is just a very passionate hobby of mine, so this DLSR fits my needs perfectly in affordability and function. There are tons of reviews of this camera on Youtube. I definitely recommend checking those out as it's nice to see a video of it in action.

Reviews.Title: Great DSLR Camera (My second Nikon DSLR)
Reviews.Author: Alex Blum "Video Gaming"
Reviews.Content: This was an upgrade from my Nikon D40.  I have had many digital cameras over the last 15 years, and a couple film cameras before that.I finally decided to upgrade and go with the D5100. I had a holiday to Florida, and we were going to be on the beach, so I grabbed one.  I got good quality but dark photos for the first 25 or so shots (I somehow suppressed the flash by accident!) and then I changed it and the photos were amazing.  I got shots at the wildlife park, (turtles, parrots, birds, crocodiles/alligators, little monkeys, fish, and more), got shots of the Dolphins at the Marineland Dolphin Center (moving shots, shots of Dolphins in the air, etc) scenery, and more. Battery life is really good, I can charge it up and get it to last a very long time, over several days.  I would recommend another battery just in case.Obviously, it takes great high quality  16mp photos with relative ease.  But what did it for me was the video (my older DSLR did not do video, which always annoyed me)Love the HDMI port, SD Slot, rechargeable battery, 1080p video, lcd viewfinder that folds out, picture quality, etcTurning on the video is somewhat awkward, menu takes a little getting used to...Would buy this model again.

Reviews.Title: What are you waiting for!?  Buy it!!
Reviews.Author: CCP
Reviews.Content: There are so many lengthy, detailed reviews about this camera, written by experienced photographers.  If you're truly serious about buying an SLR camera, then I assume you've already done your homework and read these reviews.So, there's really only one more thing I can add to these reviews, especially as a beginner in photography:  WHAT ARE YOU WAITING FOR!?!  This camera is AWESOME.  Quit reading about it and just buy it already!!  It is every bit as good as everyone says it is.  JUST. DO. IT.

Reviews.Title: Love this Camera!
Reviews.Author: C. Ellis "sliders7"
Reviews.Content: I lost my D60 on a flight return to Europe. Heartbroken, I looked for a replacement and decided on the 5100. Now, I loved my 60 but this camera is great! I was already familiar with controls as they are not that much different so once the battery was charged up it was good to go. The clarity of the pictures are sensational and the flip screen monitor is a super upgrade from my 60. However, I wished it used the same battery as the 60 so I wouldn't have to order another battery. Other than that, the consolation in losing my beloved camera (which was a gift) is enjoying the benefits and features of this one. Take the time to learn the "pro" settings, I also ordered,The Newbies Guide to the Nikon D5100: The Beginners Guide to Using an SLR Like a Proand it's a great step toward advancing your skills with this awesome camera.

Reviews.Title: Amazing!
Reviews.Author: Oscar
Reviews.Content: this is an amazing product, i recommend it to anyone, novice or not, i used to have a nikon d80 and i needed to upgrade it, so at 575 dlrs with a lens.... cant argue with that... i mean in mexico this cammera its worth 13 mil pesos (around 1000 dlrs), so with this kind of difference in price i had to buy it.

Reviews.Title: Best camera I've ever owned, bar none.
Reviews.Author: John Galt
Reviews.Content: I've owned several high-end point & shoot cameras and several DSLR's. My Canon G9 was the best of the bunch, until now. This is, by far, the best camera I have ever owned. It simply cannot take a bad photo. I took tons of photos of my child's indoor sporting event last week. Taking decent indoor sports shots has to be the most difficult type of photography I can imagine. But even with just the kit lens, the photos were spectacular. I never used the flash. (In addition to the kit lens, I would recommend getting the 50mm prime also. I find myself using it a lot.) To summarize, just buy this camera and forget about everything else. I don't think you'll find a better camera at a better price.

Reviews.Title: Great for point & shooters!
Reviews.Author: Robert E. McGill
Reviews.Content: With my limited budget I bought this Nikon D5100 body as a back up for my D7000. My plan is to keep the 18-55mm on one body and my excellent 85mm f1.8 on the other. (To switch cameras instead of switching lens). I heard both cameras had the same sensor but now I'm not so sure. The D7000 gives sharp photos with crisp, accurate colors. This is not so easy to get with the D5100 due to less options for customization. I bought this camera from a seller on Amazon in 'like new' condition. I'm still learning how to get what I want from this camera. I recently upgraded the firmware and this seems to help. So far I like the in-camera HDR feature and the articulated screen (wish the D7000 had this). I probably will buy an after market battery grip for this camera, as is, it feels too small for my hands. I would recommend this camera especially to beginners. Great for point & shooters, but if you want more control be prepared to spend more time in the menu.

Reviews.Title: My First Digital SLR Camera
Reviews.Author: Shaneface
Reviews.Content: This is just a first impression review because, I've only had the camera for a couple days. So far, I am enjoying my D5100 a lot. I am finding a lot of tutorials on YouTube.com that are helping me learn the basics. I already know that I will be investing money into new lenses, probably a Nikon 50mm f/1.8D AF Nikkor Lens for Nikon Digital SLR Cameras first and then a Rokinon FE8M-C 8mm F3.5 Fisheye Lens for Canon - Black for filming my friends' skateboarding. I am having trouble finding a video editing software I feel comfortable using. I'm not sure whether to go with Adobe Premiere, Sony Vegas, or what! Also, I've heard editing HD video can be hard on your computer (vista+4GB RAM=meh).SO yeah, I've got a long confusing road ahead of me.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Ania
Reviews.Content: I love it so far :) didn't have a chance to try all the options but the basic ones work really well.

Reviews.Title: AMAZING photos
Reviews.Author: rebeccaa1989
Reviews.Content: I am not an experienced photographer just wanted an awesome camera . This camera will take me a while to figure everything out but i am very satisfied with it :) light weight great special effects absolutly in love worth the money great investment. In the future ill have to get more lenses :)

Reviews.Title: First DSLR and cant imagine anything better
Reviews.Author: Stephen Mammay
Reviews.Content: I know im coming from a limited point of view, but this camera is amazing.  I never knew I could take such beautiful pictures.  My wife complained about the expense until she saw the pictures of our kids on vacation that I was able to take that never would have looked even acceptable on our old point and shoot.I cant speak to how this camera compares to others in its class, but IMO, its in a class of its own!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera Great Price
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey Carpenter
Reviews.Content: This camera is amazing. It's everything i hoped for in a starting DSLR. I was debating on whether to get a Canon (like my friends have) or a Nikon. I saw some reviews and decided on the Nikon. Glad I did. I love this camera. Can't wait to get more lenses for it.

Reviews.Title: Great photo quality!
Reviews.Author: Darrin Lowery, Author
Reviews.Content: I bought the camera recently here on amazon, on sale. The price online was cheaper than in the electronics stores. And I paid no tax and shipping was cheap. I just got back from the aquarium here in Chicago and took some amazing shots. I'm not a pro. I typically use my Nikon D60 for everything. I got the D5100 for the video feature, but after using it, it proved to do do much more. The filter effects are nice, but again my primary focus was video. I recommend this camera highly, although I didn't use the standard lens it came with. I use the 50mm lens. I can't say enough about the photo quality. The colors were rich and the images are crisp. If I can find out how, I'll post pics so you can see what I mean. For me it was a great buy!

Reviews.Title: Great DSLR
Reviews.Author: Hugo
Reviews.Content: This camera is truly amazing. It is certainly not the best dslr out there but this is a great one for all dslr starters. It has many features that you can play around with. It has amazing picture quality and video quality too. I recommend this to anyone that is looking for their first dslr.

Reviews.Title: Great purchase
Reviews.Author: Ricardo Obregón
Reviews.Content: Just received the camera, very happy with it, easy to use :) I'm a beginner and it has not been so challeging to use it. Advanced and basic functions are well documented in the manuals (included in the package).Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Improvement on D 80
Reviews.Author: David
Reviews.Content: Right out of the box using the same lens (18 - 200 VR)this camera takes better pictures than my previous Nikon D80. I bought the body only. I am a family photographer and the D5100 is the  ideal Nikon camera for me.  Simple to use, lightweight, video if necessary, and well priced.  I considered the D7000, but in reality, I would never use the added feature set and have instead bought a 35mm Prime lens and an extra battery and am still $300 ahead! Photos thus far have been great, without the frustration of obvious exposure issues I experienced with the D80.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: David R. Hughes "Rugger"
Reviews.Content: Firstly, Amazon's delivery was very fast.  I had the camera 4 days after I ordered it with standard shipping.  Great job.The Camera itself is a great step up from what is now my secondary camera, the D60.  Focus is nice and crisp, and even on the Sports setting, the camera is lightning fast.  There is a lot to this camera, so read the manual first ! !  I also purchased a battery grip for it, and you will find that does make up for the camera's compact size (the only drawback I have encountered so far).Great job Nikon.

Reviews.Title: Nikon D5100 is the shizz!!!!!
Reviews.Author: acousticmany
Reviews.Content: The Nikon D5100 with AF-S VR DX 18-55 mm stock lens is my first DSLR.  This camera is absolutely amazing for the price and the photos you can achieve with it.  I also purchased the Polaroid Optics +1 +2 +4 +10 lens kit and I have taken some very good macro shots that I could never take with previous point and shoots or high end digital zoom cameras.  I've only had for just a few days so I am not 100% familiar with all the functions yet.  Most of my use has been in Landscape, Aperture priority and Shutter priority modes but I am already in love with this camera.  The bokeh is amazing with this camera and even better with the Polaroid Optics kit.I highly recommend this camera to anyone that is considering purchasing their first DSLR.  I have played around with Canon but I always went back to Nikon for some reason.  Maybe it was the feel of the camera or the look or the weight, or a combination of all of this most likely.  To me Canon's are like Macs and Nikon's are like PC's.  I am more of a PC guy so I really like the functionality and versatility of Nikon.  But then again everyone has different tastes.  So I say explore and do your research before purchasing a camera but check out the Nikon D5100 before deciding.  I tried over 20 different camera's.  I wanted to spend a lot but the more I thought about it I figured I could achieve the same types of photographs with this camera than a really high end camera and I am very very satisfied with the results so far.  Do NOT spend $24895720489520458 if you are NOT a professional photographer.  Save your money, practice and master technique, purchase good lenses and you will achieve photographs you never dreamed of.

Reviews.Title: Great for still, so-so for video
Reviews.Author: Mark
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to replace my D80 so I could shoot video as well as stills. I use to carry a ultra compact camera or my DV camcorder to shoot video and would have to switch cameras. The camera is great for stills. The big problem with DSLRs is the auto focus during video. The D5100 focuses quickly, but unfortunately hunts for its subject in a pattern of 4 adjustments. It focuses slight in front of subject, then behind, then in front, and finally on the subject. This creates a distracting "in and out" of focus pattern that I felt was unacceptable. The auto focus function is also noisy and easily picked up on the build in mic. An external mic would be needed for decent sound capture if using auto focus. The D5100 can focus in single shot mode. Meaning you can depress the shutter button to refocus when needed. Ultimately, what I discovered is that D5100 is not appropriate for semi-serious video using auto focus. It is usable for casual video capture if you pre-focus and use manual focus to shoot videos.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: SIVARAMAN CHIDAMBARAM
Reviews.Content: Excellent pictures!!! Purchased this especially for my new born baby. We stopped going to studios to take pictures of my baby...!!!

Reviews.Title: Delivery & Product condition as expected
Reviews.Author: Amol Phadke "Amol"
Reviews.Content: The camera was delieverd in time and in good condition.  Great camera & easy to use. Good pictures but needs polorizing filter if taking pictures in bright sun in Auto mode.

Reviews.Title: Excellent all around system
Reviews.Author: Patrick Holt "txdragon"
Reviews.Content: This camera has features that go well beyond a entry level Dslr.  In fact with the addition of a hot shoe adapter that allows a PC cord connection, this is flat out a great camera.  Great low noise photos at higher ISO's.  If you looking at the Nikon line, I would recomend save some extra money by buying this cameras, and invest the saved money in some nice fast glass.

Reviews.Title: working report on the D 5100
Reviews.Author: Filmmaster 6
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent camera for those photographers who do low light shooting, The colors are brilliant and clear. I have used this camera in the studio and on location and find that it is comparable to my D 300s without the extra weight. Granted there may be some features that it does not have , however as a second camera it is an excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: V. Morris
Reviews.Content: I'm just a weekend/vacation (at best) photographer. I don't need overly complex. I don't want too simple. So, the D5100 with much of what makes the D7000 such a stunning performer, but with less fuss over settings, is absolutely perfect for me. I did buy the kit and I had gotten the 55-200 MV VR lense with the D3100. While the lense is certainly up to most challenges, I will at some point upgrade to better glass as I've always believed nothing can be better than the weakest link. Still, the pictures these lenses are producing are simply stunning.HDR is good. It's not quite as significant as the manual suggests (you have to push exposure over and under to get maximum results), but I didn't buy the camera for HDR to begin with. I'm also not a big videographer, but have taken a few videos and was pleasantly surprised at the quality. Autofocus works a bit slow in lower light, but in bright light, my videos were nice and in-focus. I did buy a really good Sandisk 16 GB Class 10 card, so I suspect it helps as well.Setting up the camera is simple and straight forward. I didn't even have to read the manual in much detail, except to get a few refence points. I do recommend downloading the fuller PDF user guide suppled with the camera, as it provides more information than the book in the box.

Reviews.Title: This Camera takes excellent photos at Auto and no flash
Reviews.Author: Rawi Rabbat "Rawi Rabbat"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as a gift to my wife...I ended up using it much more than she did...I am taking daily photos of my new born twins..Photos are really amazing...I am no expert in photography and thats why I prefer to shoot on auto and without flash, photos that some out are exceptional...worth the money...I am using the basic 18:55 lens that comes with the package and planning to buy soon the 35mm prime protrait lens then later on the 55:200 lens when my kids get older..I recommend anyone to purchase this camera...

Reviews.Title: Firmware Bug! - Easy to fix
Reviews.Author: Samtrix
Reviews.Content: We just bought this camera, but it turns out there is a bug in the software. Specifically, certain SD cards cannot be used. After talking with their tech support, it appears to be the SanDisk Ultimate/Extreme cards. The other brands, and older cards work fine.You can find the firmware fix by googling "D5100 firmware upgrade".  It'll be one of the top results from Nikon Support.Unfortunately, you need a SD card that works to upload the firmware, so if you buy this camera from Amazon, buy a SD card from another manufacturer than SanDisk.We finally were able to install the firmware patch, and the camera works great with all of the SD cards including SanDisk.So, in review, there is a bug with the camera preventing it from using certain SD cards.  It can be fixed relatively easy, but you just need an old SD card to make it work.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful Picture Quality
Reviews.Author: Eyvah Yashen
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera about a week ago. thought the button layout takes a little getting used to and the live view is horrible, but the picture quality more than makes up for it. I took awesome night shots at 100 iso. the range of settings on this camera really offer a wide range of possibilities.

Reviews.Title: An Excellent Pro-sumer grade camera
Reviews.Author: Stormbringer
Reviews.Content: The D5100 was purchased as an upgrade from the Nikon D40.  I must say that it was money well spent and a great step up.  As a co-worker told me about this camera, "It just takes great pictures!"  It's true.  With the Scenes settings, you can make things very simple and allow the camera to adjust to the type of shot you are making.  It will do so very well.  If you're more of a hands-on/advanced type, there are plenty of ways for the photographer to take full charge of the settings to manipulate the shot.  The first day I got this, I took it to a nightclub to shoot a band.  Paired with a Tamron 18-270mm zoom lens, I was really stunned at how good the shots turned out.I couldn't be happier with the purchase and would definitely recommend this model.

Reviews.Title: Great camera! Very happy with purchase!
Reviews.Author: Thomas M. Mcdonnell
Reviews.Content: This is my first DSLR camera, and so far I love. We've taken about 500 pictures so far and have gotten some incredible photos that I'm sure I wouldn't have been able to capture without the advanced abilities of this camera.There is definately a bit of a learning camera, even coming from an "Advanced P&S;" camera like the Canon G series, but the payoff is definately worthwhile. I was able to get some great stop action shots of my son during a TKD demonstration while he was in midair and also just at the split second when he was breaking a board and his foot had just cracked the board - absolutely priceless shots!The camera seems to take very nice HD video, although I haven't played with that a lot as it was not my intended use of this camera. It is nice to have the option though if I don't have our HD camcorder with us and want to take video.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful camera for beginner
Reviews.Author: Jack Merritt
Reviews.Content: I have not used an SLR camera for over 20 years.  I received the camera perfectly packed.  Set up was effortless.  I was able to take great pictures immediately using the auto settings.  With the help of Lynda.com and D5100 for Dummies I was using this camera like a pro in a month.  This camera is set to save pictures in jpeg but you can change it to save them in RAW format or both jpeg and raw formats.  I had no idea what raw format was when I bought this camera but the post production changes I can make using raw is amazing.  One thing to know is that not all memory cards are the same.  The faster the card the faster you can take pictures using the continuous picture mode.  I highly recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera for many uses
Reviews.Author: Chase
Reviews.Content: First dslr camera purchase and I have to say it was money well spent. The picture quality is amazing with 16.2mp, and 1080 hd video quality is not to be overlooked. The camera controls are a bit tricky but that's why you purchase a camera with so many functions. Certainly not only for point and click, but has auto features that would trump any consumer level camera. I recommend setting aside some extra cash to purchase other lenses so that you can really appreciate this camera. Packed with the 18-55 mm lens, this camera is a definate must have for any beginning photographer.

Reviews.Title: The HDR works
Reviews.Author: T. Jeu
Reviews.Content: I was on the market to purchase a DSLR when D3100 & D7000 were just released. I pre-ordered both then dropped D7000 due to its high price. I regret this decision until D5100 came up. However, after reading a review from the Nikon D5100 w/ kit lens, I paused for a while to purchase this camera. The review was 4-star, talking about the swivel screen, HDR in camera processing, and feel cheap.But now, the price of D5100 is down to a level that I can't resist. For the price of one D7000, I can have both D3100 & D5100 give and take of $100. I have many lenses and accessories in common. D3100 is a good back-up system.To defense the previous review arguments, I list my personal favorable reasons as following.(1) I use a screen protector on the swivel screen and flip it out all the time. I don't worry about it being scratched. After swivelled use, I reset it to this normal position immediately.(2) HDR in camera process works quite well. It is better than Photoshop HDR 3-photo process. Many people are frustrated with SONY's HDR process. They feel that the processed images are too artifact. Not here with Nikon. I posted 2 images on this product's photo with notes. The key of getting the good image is steady hands or using a tripod. Use spot-metering instead of matrix metering is also a good tip. Just a reminder, assigning the fn button for HDR will make it one button prcess, not 6-7 press keys process like previous reviewer pointed out.(3) Lighter camera is a trend now. D5100 weights 3/4 of D7000. For a non-professional photographer like me, it saves me a lot of shoulder grease.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Thomas
Reviews.Content: Lots of features.  Good camera for the beginner who wants a camera that will not limit them in the future and has many features for the professional as well.  Large screen which folds away when not needed.  Will save photos in BOTH JPEG and RAW.  I did a lot of research before buying and this camera beat competitors in features and performance.  I would recommend a card reader however.  The rubber cover over the cable connections seems a little flimsy.  I decided to get a card reader instead of toggling the cover over and over again.  Other than that - love it.

Reviews.Title: Just the Kelvin color temperature is missing
Reviews.Author: Avinash
Reviews.Content: I am using this camera from last 2 days and taken around 300 shots, image quality is fantastic, light sensitivity is awesome, i just noticed Kelvin color temperature is missing, it's not a big issue but lack in feature, but the auto color mode works like charm.I have bought this camera for shooting still images, but still for testing i have shot a video and that was awesome.I have not shot in scene modes till now so I m not going to review on that.By the way when I first hold this camera i fill very shortage of buttons in the left of screen, like d90 or its predecessors have and also i have to practice changing aperture in manual mode (which I use mostly) because there is no font wheel and i have to use same wheel with thumb and another figure on the +/- button on the top.But overall is worth buying, I like trying new things and this is best for me right now.I recommend this camera.[update 2/21/2013] Still happily using this Camera, did about 20 tours, many many parties at home. I feel like a good photographer now :D .after millions of shot it is working as it worked on the very first day.

Reviews.Title: Great First SLR
Reviews.Author: Robert Young
Reviews.Content: My fiancee bought me this camera for my birthday this year (totally awesome surprise for me).  I've been thinking about getting an SLR for a while, but never took the plunge (due to not fear of spending too much on lenses/accessories).So far I've yet to purchase any additional lenses, so have been shooting with the 18/55mm kit lens so far (will hopefully be getting the 35mm f1.8 in the near future).  While I'm only shooting at max aperture f3.5, the pictures so far have turned out great, especially in low lighting.  The beginner friendly interface on the UI to help you find the right ISO/aperture/shutter speed has helped me immensely in getting nice pictures.After owning the camera for less than 2 weeks, I'm able to pretty quickly set the ISO/aperture/shutter on the camera (custom button set to ISO).  It would definitely be nice if there was a second dial, but I've found it overall pretty easy to get used to.  Looking forward to getting my first prime lens (and being able to actually get some decent bokeh in some shots).

Reviews.Title: Good starting SLR camera
Reviews.Author: J. Rojas "Jahir Rojas"
Reviews.Content: Excellent camera; this is my first digital SLR, I have not explode all the good functions available because I opened the package and immediately started to use it to capture vacation pictures but I was not hard to shoot first photographs. Image and video quality is amazing. A must buy for this camera should a better lense -I was suggested to acquire a 16-85mm for the everyday scenarios- because the included one - 18-55mm- has only 3X zoom

Reviews.Title: Great camera but Live View mode is unacceptably slow
Reviews.Author: Seth Wandersman
Reviews.Content: I upgraded from the Nikon D70s and was excited to have an articulated screen with a live view because I often want to take pictures from either a high or low angle and sometimes take self portraits. Unfortunately the shutter lag when using Live View is so slow that I could never use it for anything involving people.

Reviews.Title: Best thing I got for myself
Reviews.Author: Deba
Reviews.Content: This is the best camera I have used. Last year I had purchased and used Nikon D5000. But this year I decided to buy this D5100. This is just great. Picture quality is just excellent. No words to express it. I took it for my hiking trip to Mount Washington. The pictures came so so good..It is Just as if i didn't see the views so clear in my own eyes.. Unbelievable ..Only thing which I don't like to changing the lenses frequently.. But that's the way it is..I have to deal with that..Otherwise pay some fat bucks for a better lense..

Reviews.Title: Good Features
Reviews.Author: William J. Stainbrook
Reviews.Content: Nikon did themselves proud with this new design. The features packed in it, make it one of the best cameras for the money. It's a matter of preference between it and the new Cannon. The images are crisp and full of detail and the color is balanced and true. The HD video sets the standard that others will have to quickly hustle to match. My only wish is that it had a full frame sensor rather than the DX format, but for my use, I will probably never see the difference. I am totally stoked with this camera. It also fits the hand well.

Reviews.Title: Can't beat it in the compact slr niche
Reviews.Author: yk michael
Reviews.Content: Size and weight is very important to me, so I upgraded to the D5100 from my D60. I've got small hands, so I have no difficulty using a small SLR.As far as being a camera goes, it shoots as fast as I need at 4 fps and the image quality is excellent, especially at higher ISO with prime lenses. Nikon seems to be committed to DX for the long term so the lack of an internal focus motor does not concern me. I recommend the DX AF-S 35mm 1:1.8G lens at fairly low cost to achieve excellent indoor and lower light results.As far as being a video camera goes, if you want to record quality videos I'd recommend you purchase a quality video camera.The flip out screen is an somewhat aggravating gadget to me, but if you are hell bent on using the camera for video I'd say it makes sense in that regard.With respect to the kit 18-55 lens, it's light weight and for a hundred bucks brand new just can't be beat. I'd recommend owning one even if you are going to own/use a variety of lenses. To me it's a good value general all purpose lens for the money.I can't comment on the environmental sealing of the camera and cold weather operation as I havn't used it in less that ideal condtions yet. I live in a very cold wilderness environment and will be carefully using the camera in temperatures far below zero. I never had a problem in three years of using the D60, so I'm banking on the same cold weather performance from the D5100.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera
Reviews.Author: ToddW
Reviews.Content: Bought this as a gift for my wife for mothers day. We had been reviewing different cameras and this one had it all for the price. Loved that it came with the lens instead of having to purchase after the fact. We really liked the mega pixels and the fact that it has video recording in HD. Pictures and video are incredible. When we compare our pictures we took from our 10mp point and shoot camera with our new camera its like looking at a TV at 720p vs a flat screen with 1080p. Even our pictures look like High Def now!Love this camera and definitely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: Impressed
Reviews.Author: J. Ludwick
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased this Nikon D5100 camera and have since replaced the kit lens with the Nikon 18-200mm VRll and have a 35mm f/1.8G AF-S on order.  I have absolutely no complaints about this camera or it's lens, everything works perfectly.  I don't mind the use of a plastic body for lighter weight as there's enough heft to this camera (and the 18-200 lens) to make you aware that you are holding something of significant value.  I've reassigned the 'Fn' button to adjust the ISO on the fly since I primarily use aperture priority (nice touch btw).  I'm currently looking into the ideal camera bag for travel... possibly the Lowepro Fastback 250, as I want to keep the 18-200 lens attached.The built-in flash does NOT work as 'commander' for wireless flash use... not a deal breaker though.

Reviews.Title: DSLR Newbie
Reviews.Author: Victor M. Susanto
Reviews.Content: Great DSLR camera to start out with.  Making my self taught, gradual steps from Auto (including Scenes/Effects) to Shutter priority and Apert Priority.  Will get to Manual soon, when I graduate myself there.  That's the great thing about this camera, it can ease you into the hobby and make you feel like a professional in no time!Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Great Image Quality & Usability at an a Affordable Price
Reviews.Author: Paul
Reviews.Content: The image Quality from the D5100 is outstanding for the price. The features of the D5100 are easy to deploy in general photography, without the usual complexity of figuring how to deploy them. This is why I bought the camera. It's just easy to use the relatively advanced features.The Hi1 and Hi2 ISO modes are useful when you need to capture images at lower quality in lower light, and the high grain effect of the ISO 102,000 is a lot of fun. The in-camera editing capability is fun, but doesn't replace in-computer editing functionality. It's handy nonetheless if you need to do edit images quickly after shooting, before uploading them online, for example.For a first time Nikon Digital SLR user, the position of the buttons, Live View etc are very intuitive and the redeployed buttons don't pose the challenge that users of older Nikon DSLR models claim. The LCD Viewfinder is as good as other reviewers have commented and while the Depth of Field preview is missing, the LCD screen preview works (for me anyway). Being able to assign the ISO Level to the button beside the flash button makes it even easier to use the camera without having to navigate the menus to get the right shot settings.The kit lens is OK as a starter lens, and I agree with other reviewers that you'll want to add better lenses to take advantage of the amazing images this camera is capable of producing. I've added the Stereo Microphone for some HD Videos I've produced and it's worth the money only if you need to do tripod based videso with very clear sound. Otherwise the built in Mic is fine.All in all, a great buy. Absolutely delighted with it.

Reviews.Title: My New Toy
Reviews.Author: Eloisa Padilla
Reviews.Content: As soon as i received my new camera I strated clicking away, it took me a while but I am getting the hang of it. I am still learning how to use it and still finding new ways and features this camera has. I know I  am going to have lots of fun using my new Nikon D5100 with all the cool effects it has to offer.

Reviews.Title: Great all round camera
Reviews.Author: JSJ
Reviews.Content: This is an absolutely brilliant camera. I have been using the Nikon d3000 and bought this for a company I worked with in Vietnam. Practically some of the issues I have found with my d3000 include a slow internal computer (so images take a while to process enough to be able to review them on the screen), slow autofocus and limited ISO range. All of these are far better in the d5100.You should be aware of a few things. 1.) When in video mode the aperture settings will say that they are changing but in actuality the aperture will stay the same. You need to go out of live view, change the aperture and then go back into live view. Once live view is on aperture does not change. 2.) Don't shoot with live view, bro. It is far slower than shooting through the viewfinder, the exposure that is shown on the screen isn't always accurate and when you hit the shutter it takes about a second before the camera will capture your image. Live view shouldn't sell this camera for you. 3.) Finally, the area around the memory card slot gets really overheated when you are shooting video for a long period of time. I haven't had any issues yet but I am worried about what that is doing to the camera and the card.I love this thing, and if I had the money I would buy myself one personally. Having said that, if I had the money I would buy a D4. I will recommend that if you are looking at buying this as your first dlsr camera and you have limited funds to buy a lower quality body and get extra lenses. I woud rather have my d3000 with my 50mm f/1.4 than this d5100 with only the stock lens.

Reviews.Title: Great starter DSLR camera from point and shot....
Reviews.Author: Christy
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for almost a year. No problems what so ever. The picture quality is great however there is a bit of a learning curve at the beginning. I purchased the Nikon D5100 because it takes HD video at 1080i. I will say this the video does come out a bit choppy from time to time. Another reason for this purchase was to take quality pictures of my baby girl who is almost 1 year old. If you are looking for a solid camera that is not to expensive buy with confidence. One thing to point out I only purchased the body not the lens that came with it. Currently I have a Nikkor AF-S 50mm 1:1.4G mm for portraits which takes awesome pictures and a Nikkor AF-S 18-200mm 1:3.5-5.6G II ED telephoto lens which I use 80% of the time plus the SB700 flash. Trust me the flash makes a huge difference.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera - will not autofocus with older lenses
Reviews.Author: C. Swanson "c_swanson"
Reviews.Content: Love the camera with one exception. If you are an amateur photographer like me and have been using Nikon for years (I bought my first Nikon, a Nikkormat, in 1965), you probably have several lenses. Some of mine are not very old, I bought them after getting my first digital body. Be aware that only the latest generation Nikkor lenses will be able to auto-focus with this camera.  Your older lenses will still work, but you have to manually focus when you use them. I was aware of this when I bought the camera, but though my more recent lenses would work, they don't.

Reviews.Title: Had it about a week...
Reviews.Author: TwinkiesMommy
Reviews.Content: It's my first DSLR after years with a 35mm SLR and various digital POS's.  I did research for over a month deciding which camera of this class I wanted to get (I compared the different brands too and my old 35mm is a Canon).  I decided to go with this one and I have not one single regret.  LOVING it!

Reviews.Title: OUTSTANDING
Reviews.Author: D. Wilber
Reviews.Content: I have been involved in photography for sixty years using the medium and 35mm format.  The Nikon D5100 is amazing!!  Outstanding image quality at ISO 100 to 800.  If you desire outstanding image quality even with moderate cropping of the full size image making beautiful 13' x 19' prints, this camera delivers.  Modern technology is a wonderful thing.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Basic DSLR
Reviews.Author: Karthik
Reviews.Content: I bought the D5100 with two Nikon lenses (18-55 and 55-250 AF-S DX VR Nikkor Zoom lens). I should say the camera has been extremely satisfactory. I am new graduate from the point and shoot Canon S 120. Though I was thinking of Canon cameras, I went with my friend's recommendation. I am totally grateful to him. The layout is pretty user friendly and flip LCD screen works pretty good. Low Light pictures comes out good. I am more of a landscape photographer and am loving the 55-250 lens. The lens also comes useful for on Stage events. A definite recommendation to all those enthusiasts who want to learn photography and all its beautiful intricacies. One suggestion though, sign up for a photography class to fully enjoy the camera's various modes.

Reviews.Title: New to Photography
Reviews.Author: Richard T. Lee Jr.
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a quality DSLR for the price that could tackle my video needs while at the same time have the addition of my newfound photography.  It was after much research I found the Nikon 5100.  So far I've had for about 3 weeks and I couldn't be happier.  It's low light capability and ease of use has helped me tackle some great shots including my first ever try at concert photography.  [...].  The Video capture is very crisp as well.  I haven't used in full yet, but for test shooting it's been amazing.  The detail captured in full HD is perfect for what I needed it to do.  I have the additional 18-200mm lens and both have been everything I was looking for price and in a camera.  Plus having the sensor of the D7000 for $400 less, you can't argue that value.  Also, additionally I edited the photos using Aperture 3 on a Macbook Pro.

Reviews.Title: I am in love
Reviews.Author: Chloe
Reviews.Content: The D5100 is my new baby. Better than Canon T3i and almost like a D7000!The swivel LCD is cool, but I honestly don't use it much for live-view.I'm just awed by how great this camera is for the price. I have a good feeling that I'll be satisfied with this thing for a while.

Reviews.Title: Awsome Camera
Reviews.Author: Achernar
Reviews.Content: My D5100 just arrived and i'm extremely happy with the camera.  The grip feels great, the quality of the photos is awsome, and it has excellent low ISO features.  I highly recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Effing Amazing!
Reviews.Author: Robert J. Bresiani "Robbzilla"
Reviews.Content: I just wanted to chime in here. I bought the d5100 today, and after owning a D80 for ~2.5 years, I'm simply blown away by the improvements. Effing Amazing! This camera literally can shoot in the dark. I stuck my 18-200 lens through my blinds in my back yard, and took a picture of the shed out there. No porch light, just the ambient light from the city around it. I was in night-vision effect mode, and the pic was black and white, and noisy as heck, but wow! I could actually make out what I shot! My poor old D80 would NEVER have picked that up! The continuous shooting mode is faster than fast, the video (which I'll likely seldom use) is sharp, and the most important feature? Well, kiddos, to me that's picture quality, and it blows the doors off of my previous camera. I'm really looking forward to putting this little gem through it's paces in the next few weeks! I'll be out shooting at a nature preserve, at the local park hunting for squirrels, and just here and there annoying everyone with it! I can't wait. This new toy has made me excited about photography again!The good:Great menu system. Big improvement!Smaller/lighter than the D80 (Fits into my slimline bag better)Picture quality is outstandingFaster responseVideoTons of new features to play withCool special effects modesThe bad:I have to manual focus some of my older lensesIt's smaller, which means I have to adjust to how it feels in my handsslight learning curve (But I'll get over it)I have to go buy some bigger SD cards if I want to take pics in full res with RAW, or I'll be filling up a LOT faster (OK, not really a bad, but still...)Conclusion: I'm not looking back! This is a GREAT camera and a HUGE improvement over my old body! Great work Nikon!

Reviews.Title: PLEASED WITH PURCHASE- Megazoom to DSLR
Reviews.Author: Soozare Zoomaroo "mrwolley"
Reviews.Content: I am a former point and shoot user, who decided to upgrade to get better quality pictures. I did a few months of research, and realized that the two main contenders to suit my pocket was the Canon T3I and the Nikon D5100.T3I Vs D5100I read every article, watched every video on youtube that spoke about these two cameras and it all comes down to this: if you place your MAIN emphasis on capturing excellent stills, and you love the convenience of video but not into it seriously, then the D5100 is the camera for you. It allows you to take more useable picutes at the higher ISOs than the T3I and you get a longer battery life as well. If however, you want the brilliant pictures, and are a little more serious about videos, the manual controls offered by the T3I gives it the edge as it relates to video.D5100 PROS- Brilliant picture quality- it takes a little bit of tweaking to get it just right, but when you do, the pictures are stunning.- The build quality is good for its price range- personally, after holding both this and the T3I in my hands, i preferred the feel of the D5100 esp around the grip area.- Ease of use- as my first DSLR camera, i found it easy enough to use once you get a hang of the controls- Tilt screen- this is one of my favorite features, because it allows you to capture certain angles without having to lie flat on the ground all the time, or climb a tree- Noise profile- i found that i was able to get useable pictures at ISOs higher than 1600D5100 CONS- No built in autofocus mechanism- i found that this limited the number of lenses that could be used on the camera- No dedicated ISO button- this is such an important feature, i thought that it earned the right to have its own dedicated buttonCONCLUSIONAfter having done all the research, and deciding eventually to buy the D5100 over the T3I, i have not regretted my purchase. i think that the advantages stated above, more than compensates for the challenges faced with this camera. As the camera that has introduced me to DSLR photography, i think i am in capable hands, and have already produced pictures that people feel can easily make it to a magazine. So, as stated before, if videography is not a biggie for you, and you want to take stunning pictures, the D5100 is most definitely the camera for you.

Reviews.Title: well, not too bad
