Reviews.Author: Dakota J. Doerr
Reviews.Content: For the price, it's not an awful camera. This was my first dslr & it lasted me a long while. Great starter camera. It however does like to freeze when flipping through screens but that's not that terrible. The auto focus is mediocre. The flip out screen is handy for a LOT of reasons and i will miss that when i upgrade. Overall, worth the buy. You probably won't get a nicer one for the price

Reviews.Title: Great Little Camera!!
Reviews.Author: Stewie510
Reviews.Content: This camera is small but packs a punch!!  I am a professional photographer and I use this camera as a remote and a backup!!  I got the 50mm F1.8G for it and it is a beauty!!  This would be a great camera for Mom or kid.  I am also a photojournalism teacher/ Instructor and I would recommend this setup for any of my students/ adults/ kids wanting to learn photography.  I would always recommend to people to by the lens and the camera body separately you will be happier in the long run with this camera if you stay away from the kit that comes with a lens or lenses...  The F1.8 aperture  on the 50mm is so AWESOME it will change your religion!!  Just kidding But it is really great and will open so many shooting environments for you.

Reviews.Title: All good except viewfinder issues
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I have a d300 already, just bought d5100 this week. I can see the image quality improvement of d5100 over d300 (about 10-20% sharper and clearer, high ISO is also better, 1600 is still acceptable. But colors are not that rich as d300, and a little bit slower than d300). Overall, it's a good one. I give it four stars because of two minor (but very annoying) problems with the viewfinder:1. If I don't wear my near-sight classes, the viewfinder is blurry to my eyes however I adjust the diopter, thus I have to wear my glasses to use it. My d300 doesn't have that problem and can be adjusted easily.2. D5100 uses something like a red laser dot to indicate the focus point, frequently invisible, and it's hard to see that (unless you keep pressing shutter button), most time you don't know where your camera focus point is.  I still like my d300's golden square clear focus indicator.

Reviews.Title: wow
Reviews.Author: pee wee "powerpak"
Reviews.Content: i have a canon t3 and this product blows it away, better color better lcd, better live view, many special effects, easy to use, i bought this used because i already have several ol nikon lenses and to keep the price down. even though used it came in an original box- with cd rom etc, it actually cannot be told from new, works just great, just got it yesterday and have shoot 200 pictures- thanks amazon warehouse deals

Reviews.Title: Very disappointed
Reviews.Author: N. Santos
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased the Nikon D5100 DLSR with the 50mm, 85mm and 18-200mm lenses. After few days of usage, the camera started producing black images. Very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Ivan Vargas Arce
Reviews.Content: Excellent price. This camera is great. This is my second Nikon Camera and my first SLR. I am very happy to experience "Reflex World". It is very fast and versatile. I do not exaggerate when I say that I love this camera.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the money
Reviews.Author: H. K. "promorobot"
Reviews.Content: I shoot sports for a local paper and I am always running into "pro" photographers with their $5,000 cameras and $10,000 lenses. Obviously you need to spend big bucks for high end gear, but I needed to find that sweet spot between performance and what I could afford, and the Nikon 5100 hits it.Light sensitivity is something I really needed.  Shooting action under artificial lighting, indoors or out, is challenging. The 5100 has a maximum ISO of 6400, though it also has 4 "Hi-" settings above 6400. (I read somewhere that Hi-2 is like 25,000 ISO.)  So I can shoot at 320-500 speed and get great shots in challenging light.  It's also helpful if you invest in a low-light lens like an f2.8 or f1.8.It also has built-in retouch and trim modes so I can enhance shots mid-game, then have them ready to send after.  The 5100 had a swivel screen if you want to shoot video or take a photo holding the camera way over your head, though it takes longer for the camera to shoot when in that mode.  It takes nice video but I rarely use that feature. The 16.2MP CMOS is plenty for me but the D5200 has 24MP with all the features of the 5100.I bought the D5100 package with the 18-55 and 70-200 lenses and bag for $750.  I then added a Nikon f1.8 50mm lens for $220 and the Sigma 70-33mm leans for $144.  Toss in a $20 monopod and I'm ready for anything.

Reviews.Title: Works well
Reviews.Author: Lori W.
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my 13 year old Granddaughter that is interested in photography. Easy to use as point and shoot but gives her a camera she can grow with as her knowledge in photography grows.

Reviews.Title: OK for beginners
Reviews.Author: Baku
Reviews.Content: - same sensor as higher model D7000- good in low light- display is not usable as you would want to use viewfinder to compose your shots, viewfinder is dark.- display has a great chance of breaking/damaging- interface is not user friendly, menu functions not readily accessible,- not enough dedicated buttons on body- no AF motor for older lenses- AF assist is really good in low light, locks focus in all situations- DX format, not many lens available- no MF/AF switch on body- no in-body image stabilization- lightweight and compact- only 1 SD card slot- great battery life- video AF is poor- turns out doesn't work with Nikon flash system as a commander- sync speed is only 1/200 sec

Reviews.Title: I love this camera!
Reviews.Author: Cigarbuff "Cigarbuff"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera at Amazon during December with the 18-55[comes w/it] $429 and 55-300 lensNikon 55-300mm f/4.5-5.6G ED VR .[$250....$150 off] Incredible camera and lenses. I recommend getting some books on it for your Kindle, Nook , tablet or hard copy[$10-$20].. You will learn so much more than in your user manual. Buy a grip... Vello BG-N6 Battery Grip [$39] for Nikon D5100  to go with it and a very nice backpack Lowepro Pro Runner 350 AW[$125]  and flashYongnuo YN-565EX ETTL Speedlite [$105] for Nikon [ and you will be very happy!  See my reviews on the other products I suggested. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: My first DSLR camera...AMAZING!
Reviews.Author: Dushko
Reviews.Content: Hi everyone,I am new in the DSLR world and Nikon D5100 is my first camera of that kind.Like many, I guess  - I did a lot of research before I buy this camera. I was looking for something that will meet my needs, something for my level of “professionalism” and something that will be easy to learn.And I am glad that I did the right choice. This camera is that and so much more.One of the first things that will help you to understand your camera is the menu. Is simple and self-explanatory.  As well as the manual.I am type of person who doesn’t want to shoot at “auto” mode (that was the reason I switched from point-and-shoot cameras), so I am playing a lot with the Professional modes (M,A,S, P). Do understand all this modes better; I was using the book “Nikon D5100 – From Snapshots To Great Shots”, by Rob Sylvan.Although the manual that comes with the camera, as I said, is doing a great job – this is also a “must have book” for this camera.It’s free to download in PDF version.It’s not easy to adjust the proper settings at various situations, tough…but with good practice, your Nikon will deliver excellent photos. I purchased this camera together with 18-55 kit lens.  And I expected to be heavier that they actually are, but no…the camera body fits perfectly in your arms.The photo quality is excellent (I put my setting to shoot large files) and the HD Video as well. I was really surprised by the microphone – I guess I am used to my microphone from point-and-shoot cameras, so I was happy to find that this one actually records perfect audio.The truth is, I cannot compare this camera with any other from this kind. Like I said, it’s my first.But for the money wise, quality of photos and the kit lenses  – it’s just perfect.Also, the flip screen was one of the reasons I decide for this camera ( I found out that not many cameras have this) – which is very helpful when shooting from ground level (which I do)As you will read in many books and magazines (which I highly recommend when buying this kind of camera) – the camera itself will not make you better photographer. Playing with it, practicing and spending time behind it, however – it will.I hope my review helped to someone who is in dilemma what to buy.When I will became an expert in few months & years, I will write again :)Cheers!

Reviews.Title: Great buy!
Reviews.Author: Nain
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as my first (and only) DSLR. I am not looking to upgrade in the future. I love this camera. I've tried my friends' D40 and D3100, as well as Canon T3, but there's something really nice about this camera.

Reviews.Title: Great DSLR
Reviews.Author: mooseswamp
Reviews.Content: This is my first DSLR and I came to find it by way of Ken Rockwell's photography site. I don't know a lot about photography but this feels like a great camera to me. It has lots of settings I don't use but also some key ones that I really enjoy. It feels and acts like a professional camera without the super high price tag. If you're like me and want a great DSLR but don't want to spend a ton of money on something that isn't your career - this comes recommended by me.

Reviews.Title: Nikon D5100
Reviews.Author: Jessica Scheno
Reviews.Content: I love this camera, when I got it it look brand new and came in a really nice nikon bag.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: RazorR
Reviews.Content: Love the camera.  The settings are a little overwhelming at times for beginner.  Would recommend an guide to help explain more.

Reviews.Title: Really enjoy this camera
Reviews.Author: Kathleen
Reviews.Content: I really enjoy this camera.  It is a nice all around camera for my needs.  I like the flexibility of the adjustable LCD, and having the option of the good quality video, although I don't use it much.  I'm also someone who prefers using a viewfinder, and this has a fairly good quality one, although not quite as good as my D-80 had.  It is just a tad smaller than my D-80, though and I like that.  I'm still needing to practice with the menu, but think the options are plentiful and overall easy to use.  A wonderful companion to this camera, for me, has been, "Nikon D5100; From Snapshots to Great Shots" by Rob Sylvan.  It is like having a photography teacher at my side giving great advice and tips on this specific camera, as I am exploring it.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera.
Reviews.Author: MrMr
Reviews.Content: This camera is awesome.  I use it mostly for capturing my kids sporting events.  I love the continuous shooting mode and it produces very clear pictures we can print later.  I really have no complaints with it.

Reviews.Title: Engineers Review
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Wife uses this camera daily. Don't be fooled by the need to buy more expensive cameras under the guise of megapixels. This camera has plenty of resolution for great pictures with wide angle or zoom lens'. Works great with the 18-200VRII

Reviews.Title: A good choice for a DSLR without breaking the bank
Reviews.Author: Jeremy L. Lewis
Reviews.Content: I picked up a D5100 with the 18-55 mm lens and the 55-200 lens on sale at a price that was just too good to be true, and I don't regret it at all.  The thing that sold me was that the sensor was the same as in the D7000 but the price was a lot different.  The sensor is the heart of the DSLR, and the D100 delivers.  There are some neat features on it and some that are ok.  Mainly I bought this for when I don't want to carry a bigger heavier camera around all day.  The 55-200 is a decent street sweeper type lens and it is pretty sharp.  I rarely use the 18-55 except for wide angle shots.If you decide to get this, you'll have a camera that can produce some good results without having to do much editing at all.  One accessory I would pick up is a Nikon SB-400 flash for it, the on camera flash is just not powerful enough, but it does a decent job as a fill in flash.  One thing I really liked was that you could put up a grid pattern on the screen.Compared to a D-3, or even a D-2, well there is no comparison, you can't compare a pro series all metal weatherproof camera to a entry level or pro-sumer camera.  But if you just want good pictures and if you grow your skills this camera will grow with you.  All in all you can't go wrong with this camera in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera.
Reviews.Author: Shad Mika
Reviews.Content: This is my first "real"camera.  What a great value for the $!!!!  After spending about 30mins with a friend who is really into it I was able to take some awesome photos at my son's hockey game.  It takes a bit to learn, I still am, but well worth it.  Great value.

Reviews.Title: Good shape, damaged lens
Reviews.Author: Megan Johnson
Reviews.Content: The lens cannot shoot with automatic focus.  I have to adjust the focus with every angle and distance change manually. This makes macro either really difficult or not possible at all. Other than that, good shape.

Reviews.Title: GREAT CAMERA
Reviews.Author: Mario Cortes Garcia
Reviews.Content: I have been using this camera for 3 months now and have not had any issues. The quality of the pictures are what you would expect from a Nikon SLR camera. For those that have never used a SLR camera, I highly suggest that you read the manual as there are a lot of options that can only be selected/set after going through many menu clicks and options.

Reviews.Title: New to photography
Reviews.Author: GunSession "With great Power, Comes great Res...
Reviews.Content: I am a newbie to DSLR as this is my first advance camera i've owned. When coming to Amazon i was very impressed as i got this camera on sale and is very happy with it. So far i have had no hiccups. Thank God for that. Its been about 2 weeks since i've got this camera and with the default lens 18-55mm it works really nice. PIctures are clear and shooting is really nice with the view finder. Low light conditions will occur depending on which mode or setting you on. Other than that this camera is reaaall nice and I Thank God & my Parents for helping me own one today.For a complete review visit us on: [...]

Reviews.Title: great photos
Reviews.Author: mmk
Reviews.Content: I bought this also for a professional purpose but have been using it for personal pictures. They are all very nice and great to take pictures of very active baby!

Reviews.Title: I literaly clicked with it !!
Reviews.Author: Aditya Shrivastava
Reviews.Content: Awesome!! Camera and its features are superb. Make sure you are aware of all the features to make most use of it. had a wonderfull time using different effects.

Reviews.Title: Terrific Camera!!
Reviews.Author: Tiny Pieces LLC
Reviews.Content: This camera by far is an excellent choice for someone looking for a camera with a mix of ease of use for a novice and customization options for those that are more seasoned. I fall into the more of a novice category, but I like quality looking shots and prefer a quality product to obtain those shots. I have been purchasing Nikon SLR's for the past 8-10 years and I have never been disappointed. I love the movable display on the rear of the camera and thats one of the main reasons I chose this as opposed to the 3100 or 3200. The price for what you are getting is superb. I still have a Nikon D40 from 5 years ago that is functioning well so I am definitely sold on Nikon quality. When I look at my pictures they are crisp with vibrant colors. This camera feels good in the hand and will not disappoint you! Its a great deal, so buy them while they are in stock!

Reviews.Title: Fits the bill just fine!
Reviews.Author: ShowMeStateMan
Reviews.Content: Upgraded from D40 then D3100The sensor is excellent in low light and my lens of choice, Nikon 18-105mm works in perfect harmony.Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: Upgraded from the Nikon D40
Reviews.Author: Roach
Reviews.Content: Very easy to use.  I absolutely love having the option to now take hd videos, as the D40 did not have this capability. The modes are all easy to access.Overall I'm extremely happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Arrived quickly, everything as stated in article.
Reviews.Author: Judith Harmon
Reviews.Content: The camera was just as stated in the article. We ordered what we needed and got just that. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: Not so good.
Reviews.Author: lkm
Reviews.Content: Originally - loved this camera.  For the price, this was an amazing deal.  I bought this camera used, and new they go for about $900.  I got this for half price here, and was so excited to own this camera, however I never heard about the shutter issues.  My daughter and I both have had the same problem, but she had a warranty on hers and was able to ship it back to be fixed.Image quality - amazing.  Speed and response - phenomenal.  Ease of use and ability to jump right in to this camera (using manual settings) delightfully easy.I LOVE LOVE LOVE this camera - in every way, except for one issue - that is widely known - Nikon D5100 are known for shutter problems, and mine experienced it after only about 2000 images.  I am a amateur, attempting to turn pro and this hit me hard.  This is a $250 fix, with no guarantee that it will not re-occur.All in all, Nikon makes a glorious product, and you won't be disappointed -- however, make sure that you buy new (so that you know the background of the body) and you have a full warranty that you keep up so that you are not left out in the cold or out $250.

Reviews.Title: Best camera i've ever owned
Reviews.Author: BippuJRo
Reviews.Content: This camera is by far the best camera I've ever owned. Granted it is my first DSLR but, boy does this camera deliver. So many features, you never stop learning. I am a photographer by hobby not profession. Fun features and excellent quality. I would definitely recommend this camera to anyone willing to learn how to use it. If you don't have patience and give up easily then this camera is probably not for you. If you are willing to learn the possibilities are endless!

Reviews.Title: Great For a Beginning Photographer
Reviews.Author: Garth Gourley
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera looking for something that would work well for someone just starting out with photography. Simply put, I wanted a camera that I could basically use as a point and shoot, and as I developed my skill set be able to take more control over. So far it has fit that bill perfectly. Many of the settings are customizable, but work pretty well with the first click. The photos are crisp and the response of the camera is much faster than small point and shoots. Battery life seems to last forever for simple photos, but gets burned very quickly when in video mode. Video's are pretty nice and are shot at 720p. Since it will only do 30 f/s in video, slow motion isn't great.The included software is sufficient, but I wound up switching back to iPhoto for its ease of use. I had to uninstall the software just keep it from opening every time I plugged in any A/V device to my computer.

Reviews.Title: BEST PURCHASE EVER!!!!
Reviews.Author: Vikki
Reviews.Content: ....i am just a person who loves to take photos....and when i decided to upgrade finally to a dslr camera from a simple shooter i didnt hesitate to purchase a nikon camera....after much research, i found that the d5100 is just perfect for me and my skill level of photographing....after owning this over a year i am still discovering all of the amazing functions it can do....of course the photos look amazing and  it makes me happy!....i have already got 2 lenses for it with a recent purchase of a 18-300mm lens....now my camera is complete and totally awesome....Amazon as always does a great job!

Reviews.Title: Loooooove it!!
Reviews.Author: Pen Name
Reviews.Content: I was so nervous about buying a camera online and a used one at that!! However, I was not disappointed, quite on the contrary; the camera arrived within the time frame I was given and in the condition as was detailed.. When/if I decide to get another camera, I know exactly where to go!

Reviews.Title: Fantastic camera for the price. FAST SD Card required! Video records autofocus motor
Reviews.Author: R. JENNINGS
Reviews.Content: FIrst - buy a good SD card.  I'm irritated because I spent $100 more on a new Nikon over a refurb because of reports of "black photos."  I had them too -- until I got a better SD card.Second - the only bad thing I've discovered thus far is recording video. The AutoFocus motor is way too noticeable.Third - buy this camera.  I have some camera snob friends who would have rather me spend $4,000 for a camera. Sorry, wasn't going to be making my living w/ this camera.  For what I've seen, it's fantastic for a consumer who wants quality without the cost.  I don't think it can be beat.Fourth - buy a refurb from someone who is too stupid to buy a fast SD card.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Jacob L.
Reviews.Content: Everything I wanted in a camera. Easy to use. Not a heavy camera. Still learning to use different functions. I can take pictures as fast as I want to and they still come out clear.

Reviews.Title: One of the best SLR camera in the market.
Reviews.Author: Ashish Neupane
Reviews.Content: Nikon d5100 is perfect both for who want to start photography as me or for a pro.  It is very reliable and easy to use. The cost is not that high and, God, the pictures are great ! I have done some shots and I am very proud of myself and of the camera ! Great pictures.  Now, i am a Nikon fan and i don't really get those people who say canon are better in video; I did some videos with this camera and i found them great. Very good quality!! The only thing i complain about is the microphone which is not the greatest, and also the sound of the autofocus that covers everything. But, if i ever wanted to do professional video, i would buy an external mic and everything would be fine !!

Reviews.Title: Sony a55 vs sony a65 vs nikon d5100
Reviews.Author: spookycrayon
Reviews.Content: So, I first had the sony a55 for two years, and wasn't thrilled with it in the least bit. I don't know how many people reviewing these sony cameras print their pictures, but I do and the pictures always had a lot of noise in dark areas, weren't sharp, the colors were never vibrant, and I normally had to edit the crap outta them to make them look like they weren't taken with my iphone. They looked slightly better on a screen, but once printed- I would have about one good picture out of 100. And that was the a55. I thought I had just got a lemon or something, since it has so many raving reviews.So! I had a bestbuy warranty and broke the a55 after two and a half years, and because I had a sony zoom lens I could do nothing with, i decided to be upgraded to the a65. Even with a poor experience with the a55, I was so thrilled to get the a65, thinking It would be a better dslt, and I have to say it was worst as far as picture quality goes. Edges not sharp whatsoever [which is the main thing I look for in a photo], colors are faded, when I print the pictures it looks like an iPhone took them. I know how to use a camera, I tried different times of day and different settings. Also, I'm printing the pictures at an actual photo lab. I could get better pictures with a canon sx260.I was very very unhappy with the picture quality, and I showed about 6 other people the pictures and literally all of they agreed. Same terrible noise and grain in dark areas like the a55,, blurry, faded colors. The dark areas don't even have to be that dark to get noise. The pictures look beautiful on the bright LCD screen, but it's a big difference than what your actually getting.However! Some things I did like about it was how easy it is to use, it explains everything as you go through the settings [great for beginners]; how friggin fast it is (which is the first thing I noticed when I took my first picture), and the body IMO feels very sturdy.  Also, the viewfinder to lcd screen with just your eye is a nice feature. Or was that the a55? i dont remember. Besides those things, i was extremely dissapointed, and I returned it and stood at bestbuy  for half an hour debating between the nikon d5100, d5200, and d7000. I want the d7000, but it was out of my price range, so I got the d5100 to just try out a nikon; and mannn, what a difference. Huge huge huge difference. It's cheaper then the a65, and so much better as far as picture quality goes. I was flipping through some pictures last night, and they are so so vibrant and crisp without editing them. On my computer, I was flipping backwards through my pictures and all the sudden the pictures got ugly and I was like, "what happened with that one in all these beautiful ones?" And I realized it got into pictures from the a65.Im really feeling the nikon, but I will be returning it as well, this time I'm gonna get the d7000 and take the price hit, because the body of the nikon feels very cheap. I've had it a week and the battery cover won't open. Also, you have to turn a nob on the top of the camera to switch from viewfinder to LCD every time the camera turns on, and I don't use the viewfinder and that's inconvenient for me and made me miss a picture yesterday. The camera is 4fps i believe, and it is a tid bit slow if your thinking about using it for sports. Maybe you can buy a lens. Idk.And one last thing negative about the nikon is I personally don't like the Double shutter noise it makes every picture you take. Besides those, though, the picture quality is so far impressive. ive only printed a few, but they werent too shabby either. I buy a camera for the pictures, really, and if you do too, you will notice a difference in a sony vs. a nikon. I didn't think it would be a big difference when I originally bought the a55, but I regret that choice three years ago. I've wasted hundreds of pictures IMO not using a nikon.These are all my personal experiences and opinions. I don't do anything professional with photography, I just like taking pretty pictures :) and am kind of particular I guess. I'm planning on posting this on the other cameras reviews, too, in hope of helping someone else. I have done hours, days, MONTHS of reviewing a whole lot of cameras; and ended up more confused then helped. Even now, I'm typing into google "d5200 vs d7000" :)  good luck camera buyers- your probably torn between two cameras right now, and I hope this review helped.

Reviews.Title: Nikon D5100 is much better than D3000
Reviews.Author: Richard Leung "TotalCCNA com"
Reviews.Content: I just upgraded a few days ago from D3000 to D5100.  What a big difference.1. D5100 picture display is much quicker than D3000.  D3000 would take 3 sec process time to display a picture I just captured.D5100 only takes 1 sec.2. It has video capability with tilt screen.  Tilt screen let you view the object at any angle.3. Much higher ISO selection.4. It can do auto bracketing, it is very useful for HDR.  It only allows to capture 3 exposures.  Sometime I need 5 exposures, I have to do 2 of them manually.

Reviews.Title: Great all around!
Reviews.Author: Dustin
Reviews.Content: A friend of mine has a D700, and I was reluctant to buy anything less because I knew how great it was. With the right manipulation, this camera is every bit as good as the D700! Keep it in manual, and shoot away!

Reviews.Title: Good Second Body and a Very Good Value
Reviews.Author: Lopez.ufarte
Reviews.Content: I got this DSLR to complement my aging but much loved Nikon D70. I thought long and hard about getting a D7100, which has higher burst speed, better construction, more advanced auto focus system, and more external manual controls but ended up settling on this because it uses the same sensor and bide my time to go full frame format with a D600 or Canon 5D Mark III.The 5100 handles well although it could use more external controls. Given its target audience the lack if these is understandable. Picture quality is high and the sensor performs well in low light. The high resolution LCD is a very welcome step up from the tiny one in my D70.Overall the body is meaty enough for prime and medium zoom lenses. Balance is thrown off a little when mounting large glass but that's fine. This is an entry level DSLR but it does not feel cheap or fragile despite the all plastic construction.A great camera at a great price point. You could pay a lot more for the D7100, but why would you?

Reviews.Title: Amazing!
Reviews.Author: Aryma
Reviews.Content: I am so happy with this camera, there is no word to explain the feeling... It's such a great camera, the photos looks really good. I recommend! Buy without fear :)

Reviews.Title: the best thing
Reviews.Author: carlos eduardo munoz flores
Reviews.Content: the best thing i ever bought, is very easy to learn to use, totally recomended. the screen is the best

Reviews.Title: Happy with my first DLSR
Reviews.Author: frequent buyer
Reviews.Content: I got this one for my birthday. Have been using it for close to a year. No problems at all. The user manual, and the user DVD is very informative. This camera is very good for the money I paid for it. It may not be as good as a D7000 but then, you don't pay as much as you would for a D7000. So considering what I spent on this camera, I feel this one's a great deal. Regarding the features, the few couple of months I found it really hard to understand and transitions between various modes. I read the manual fully, listened to the DVD as well, kept trying and now finally I can say I have a good understanding of the various features the camera offers. So you need to be patient and spend some time to really understand what wonders this camera can do. To sum up, its a Thumbs UP to D5100.

Reviews.Title: Great for beginners
Reviews.Author: Mobile dude
Reviews.Content: I have to admit I am a beginner at photography. I did a lot of research and decided to go with the d5100. The quality of the pics are amazing. I do only auto mode but soon I will learn about the advanced settings.A tip:Make sure to get a SD card as otherwise you won't be able to save pics. Good thing I got one at time of ordering.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Picture Quality!
Reviews.Author: Raoolio
Reviews.Content: Hi, I have waited a long long time to jump from my Canon PowerShot A560 7.1MP Digital Camera with 4x Optical Zoom to my first DSLR, like every budget oriented consumer out there, I did a lot of research, I could have gone for the Nikon D3200 24.2 MP CMOS Digital SLR with 18-55mm f/3.5-5.6 AF-S DX VR NIKKOR Zoom Lens (Black), but didn't like the fixed display, then there was the new Nikon D5200 24.1 MP CMOS Digital SLR Camera Body Only (Black), but you had to pay a premium for basically the same camera with bumped megapixels and the D7000's autofocus system. I got my D5100 refurbished for $399, I think that's a great deal for such a great camera. I skipped the kit lens and went for Nikon 35mm f/1.8G AF-S DX Lens for Nikon Digital SLR Cameras and I highly recommend this combination, It allowed me to take great shots of my kids indoors without a flash, outdoor shots have great bokeh as well.

Reviews.Title: Good choice!
Reviews.Author: Jamie Schatz
Reviews.Content: Did a lot of research between Canon and Nikon, I am sure they are both good DSLR, but I am very happy with this one.

Reviews.Title: Great choice of SLR's
Reviews.Author: Joe Morrissey "Grateful"
Reviews.Content: Let's get the standard disclaimer out of the way first.  I have only had this camera for a month or so.  I got for my wife for a Valentines Day gift but I have used it 90% of the time!!  Ya gotta love it.OOTB box it seemed complicated for someone used to basic digital cameras.  Lots of buttons and jargon that I only partially understand.  But after 15 minutes or so without looking at the manual, I could do basic operations without a problem.  Things really took off after I read the getting started manual.  I spent about an hour or so going through that.  That was well worth the time.The camera is really fantastic.  The shutter speed is just fantastic.  None of that annoying wait time for the camera to adjust.  It just takes the picture when you want it to.  It is not too heavy.  It feels right in your hands.  The picture quality is amazing.  I have put the pictures I have taken so far and put them on dropbox and everyone loves the pictures.I really recommend this camera.  It does all of the basic things great and I think that it will grow with me as I get better at photography.  I can't wait to explore further!!

Reviews.Title: Made the right choice
Reviews.Author: George Johnson
Reviews.Content: I bought it for my son after trying to decide between Nikon or Canon and the newer Nikon which sported more mega pixels but as I later learned still didn't have some of the advanced features as this camera.  I finally concluded that this Nikon was a bit faster than the Canon and would fit my son's photography style a little better for what he does.  After a few months with the camera, he says he is still learning how to use it, but he loves it and is always showing a new feature on the camera he learned how to use.

Reviews.Title: It's EXCELLENT
Reviews.Author: Soph
Reviews.Content: Excellent in low light, and in every setting. I find new settings every day. This was my first DSLR and I was slightly skeptic about any camera I wanted and I picked the right one. From the lens selections to the image quality, it's nearly perfect.I only wish the waterproof casing was less expensive and it took faster continuous shots. I've been converted from Canon Powershots to Nikon. :3

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Amazonian
Reviews.Content: This is replacing my analog camera.  There is a small learning curve with switching systems, and so far my lenses and filters are interchangeable.

Reviews.Title: Excellent product
Reviews.Author: Eric Ngetich
Reviews.Content: Working very well. I may need to get an additional lens to get more out of this experience.Otherwise it is  good.

Reviews.Title: Upgraded to the D5100 from D3000
Reviews.Author: A. Iriberri
Reviews.Content: I was looking for more performance and finally settled on the D5100 as the best balance of price and features.  Overall I've been happy - it focuses far more quickly, offers higher ISO (by quite a bit) and is much less grainy in comparable low-light conditions than the camera it replaced.The pivoting screen with Live View (a feature the D3000 does not have) was also a feature I wanted, however I'm mixed on it.  No problems yet but I fear for the hinge as it seems like the most fragile part on the camera.  I love that you can use Live View and the screen to capture from creative angles (or lose less shots to a bad guess) but find myself regularly debating between the quicker viewfinder option or the LV one.  Given that I generally have the screen folded in to protect the LCD more times than not I use the viewfinder then glance down to check out the shot (as I was used to with the D3000) only to see the plastic backing panel.  I think time and practice will address that.All in all it's solid - I've yet to play with the "Scene" options or really dig into the manual settings but it's definitely an upgrade from a D3000 (which I was very happy with) and it's been seamless with all my lenses and accessories.  If you're new to DSLRs or looking to upgrade this is as solid choice - plus it's basically the same sensor as the D7000 at quite a lower price!

Reviews.Title: Great for Beginners
Reviews.Author: Carme
Reviews.Content: This is my first SLR camera so I decided to purchase one that was user friendly yet possess the features for tinkering later on when my manual modes comes into play. Was not disappointed from the first shot. The camera itself feels good, built strong and does a fine job. However depending on your needs whether it be sports, portraits, or landscapes you will need to buy the relevant lens for the job as I'm now learning. The stock lens you will outgrow in no time. Still learning something new every time I use it. I personally love the colour selection mode the first time I discovered this feature. Good buy! Strongly recommended and if you're a Nikon fan like me you will not even consider another.

Reviews.Title: Loved it
Reviews.Author: ajsivsan
Reviews.Content: This is my first DSLR and i just fell in love with it. I was looking for an upgrade from my point and shoot. Went through various reviews and most of them mentioned that the camera is good at low light. Really the camera is awesome. Low light pictures are outstanding. The pictures are crisp and clear. Need a lot to explore on the DSLR options.

Reviews.Title: Love Love love
Reviews.Author: Justin Mirelez
Reviews.Content: I would buy this camera in a heartbeat again if I needed too.I bought this camera about 10 months ago and I still love it. I am very careful with it and shoot twice a month with it sometimes more if people are visiting. The pictures are great. This has a little more features than your basic entry level dslr I've learned. I am still learning this camera. It would probably take me a couple of photography classes to learn everything on this camera.If you are  looking for a basic entry DSLR with a little more "umph" to it, this is your camera. It takes very clear beautiful photos even with the entry level lens they send with it.

Reviews.Title: best decision i could have made
Reviews.Author: Isaiah York
Reviews.Content: for the price, the quality is excellent and options available on this body are superb.. i absolutely love this body and the nifty fifty, if i can ever get quick at manually focusing. the included kit lens is pretty good too, it's my all around shooter and works well for most scenarios, but save some money for a zoom lens, otherwise you'll be sad to see that 55mm isnt all that much.

Reviews.Title: Great dslr
Reviews.Author: Subhankar Ghosh
Reviews.Content: This is my first dslr. I was split between Canon and Nikon for quite a while, but after holding this one in the local target I absolutely loved it. The build quality for this one was better than similarly priced Canon T3/T4 etc. and it feels much better in hand. The colors are very nice. You can get more technical analysis on that on any site like dpreview, so am not getting into that.One of the very useful feature for this camera is the vari-angle LCD viewfinder. In cases where the camera is awkwardly put on a tripod and you are unable to use the OVF, this can be an extremely useful feature. The kit lens (18-55mm f3.5/5.6 VC) that comes with it is amazing. Its extremely sharp, has fast and near silent autofocus and works well when used wide at 18 mm. When wide open, I have noticed slight overall softness in the lens, but that can be very easily corrected in photomatix that I use.The camera flash and the flash compensation work like a charm and so far have produced excellent lighting results for me. As an amateur, you get a lot of stuff to play with in the manual mode, starting from the obvious aperture and shutter speed control to exposure/flash compensation and many other stuff like controlling the white balance. The IR port makes remote shutter release cable free and long exposure shots a child's play.I haven't tried shooting video with it yet. But all in all, with an amazingly good kit lens, great color rendering, very well balanced flash output, I believe this camera will sweep any photography lover off his/her feet :)

Reviews.Title: Much to choose from, but this camera works
Reviews.Author: Waldo
Reviews.Content: You can spend a lot of money on cameras, this one is worth the money. Many of my friends swear by the Cannon 5D and beyond - they can be snobby - I can't afford that. When I started researching I looked at five different cameras and fell on this one for features and cost. I highly recommend buying this camera and then buying a Tamron AF 18-200 lens (workhorse multipurpose) or going for the lens you want. I use mine for video, in  fact, my desire to buy this one had to do with the mic input on the side panel. I did buy a 28 mm prime lens, so if I ever upgrade cameras, I can still use the lens. I use this camera constantly and get great video - the average person cannot tell the difference in quality.

Reviews.Title: Good camera!
Reviews.Author: Amber
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera as a "back-up" camera to my Nikon D80 and also for the purpose of recording videos.  For the price, it's a great camera!  Using my 35mm lens, it record very crisp video and the sound quality isn't terrible, either!  I'd definitely recommend it for someone wanting a more simple DSLR with the ability to record!

Reviews.Title: Nikon D5100
Reviews.Author: Dan McCoy "big Dan"
Reviews.Content: Finally got rid of my old D50 camera body and bought the 5100 body. Takes great pictures and the old lenses still work great on the new camera body.

Reviews.Title: Very Happy With This Camera!
Reviews.Author: Krista Heiser "Bibliophile"
Reviews.Content: I started out with a Nikon D40, which was perfect for a beginner DSLR user.  Moving to the D5100 was a smart move when it was time for an upgrade.  There is a bit of a learning curve involved in mastering this camera, but I feel the effort will be well worth it.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera!
Reviews.Author: Nick
Reviews.Content: My wife and I shoot a local short track asphalt racing. We had purchased a Nikon D7000 and needed another camera but couldn't quite swing the cost of another. After researching we found that the D5100 shared a lot of the same features as the D7000 at a considerable savings. While the D7000 does have a few advantages of the D5100, for the money we feel like we made a good decision.

Reviews.Title: Big step up at modest price
Reviews.Author: Desert Rat
Reviews.Content: Bought this at a great price.  Nikon was clearing inventory in an advance of the D5200.  It has a lot of features I don't expect to use but that's what you have to accept to get the ones one wants.  I was deciding between this and the D3200.  The key features this had but were lacking on the D3200 were AEB and the movasble LCD screen which lets me avoid "belly photography" in some circumstances.  It is an upgrade to my D60.  Image quality nod definately better  -- it's not just the pixel count -- specifcly lower noise (it doesn't change much from ISO100 levels ontill you approad ISO400), and EV range is about 2 stops greater.

Reviews.Title: My first trip to Vegas
Reviews.Author: Saurabh Raisinghani "saurabhrais"
Reviews.Content: I wanted a good SLR camera for my Vegas trip. Did some research and found D5100 to be a good DSLR. Thought I would  return it after the trip, if I dont like it, but after my trip I was so hooked up with the camera that I ended up  upgraded the lens to 18-105 instead of the default lens.Awesome camera for people who like to take great pictures occasionally, after all pictures are memories forever.

Reviews.Title: Rocking the DSLR
Reviews.Author: Astrocab "Daily Metro Reader"
Reviews.Content: I love my new 5100. I've been shopping for a dslr for about five years and finally bit the bullet and purchased one. I still go back and forth whether I should have gotten the 7000 but that doesn't take away from the 5100. Besides, the better investment is actually the lenses--with crappy lenses and an expensive body, you'll still get crappy photos.If I had to make the purchase again with the newly released 3200 at the same price point, I'd still go with the 5100 because in the consumer/prosumer market, I consider the 5100 an intermediate photographers camera and I wanted room to grow and not be stifled by the camera's abilities.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Mark
Reviews.Content: Exactly what i expected, the quality of the pictures is amazing the video is great everything about this camera is perfect.

Reviews.Title: Great camera. Great IQ.
Reviews.Author: papalla
Reviews.Content: My husband bought this for me as a Christmas present along with a 40mm macro lens. Both perform very well, particularly in low light where the sensor in this camera excels. Also, like the D40 it is replacing, it has a relatively small size for an SLR. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Product!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Dave
Reviews.Content: Few reason to love this camera,1. Quality Day and night time pictures2. enhanced video recording3. easy to use4. wide range of lens available5. quality product

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Matt
Reviews.Content: This is a good camera for someone who wants to take good pictures but isn't ready to spend the BIG money yet.  It takes some time to learn all the settings but it performs very well after you do.  Nikon rates this model just below "Pro" but above beginner.  It has received good reviews from several photography magazines because it performs as well as some of the higher priced models in several categories.  The only difference is that is doesn't have dedicated knobs for adjusting settings and you have to go into the menu to adjust most of them.

Reviews.Title: This is a wonderful camera
Reviews.Author: Diego De La Roche
Reviews.Content: I love it. I found a camera thas has all I need. It is simple to operate, take very good prothos and have more specifications than i expect.

Reviews.Title: Better than 5000
Reviews.Author: Ross Mackintosh
Reviews.Content: Of course yeah? lots of subtle changes that suited me. How things worked and where buttons were placed. I had a 5000 and this is a big improvement I think

Reviews.Title: Best viewfinder ever
Reviews.Author: Teresa Reinhardt "ever curious"
Reviews.Content: Finally, a viewfinder I can see stuff on!!! This is a myopic person's dream - you can use the giant (as compared to crop viewfinders) flip-screen to focus in a pinch - be that because an awkward position (over the heads of a crowd, for a macro without lying/kneeling in the dirt...) or simply to see things better if your eyesight is iffy. Only reason I bought this camera; very happy with it so far. There are some excellent deals out there right now because the successor model has already been released. 16 MP is plenty; I am contemplating buying one just in case.

Reviews.Title: Can't put it down!
Reviews.Author: bellaree
Reviews.Content: Love, love love it!  Def need 32GB SD card to do video and pics.  Seems to be better when you use the viewfinder instead of the screen for still pics.  I use it all the time!  I was between this one and the D7000 and the differences weren't worth the price difference.

Reviews.Title: versatile and easy
Reviews.Author: Generic Personage "euphoric52"
Reviews.Content: This is my fourth Nikon DSLR body, so there is a big comfort factor for me with compatibility for Nikon flash, Nikon lenses, and user interface protocols.  Image quality is slightly but noticeably better than the D5000. I've had it for two weeks, and have been enjoying the effects options and high ISO performance. No-brainer snapshots are readily accessible in AUTO mode, and low light performance is quite good with the 35mm f1.8 lens. For the price, this is outstanding.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Camera for the price !
Reviews.Author: gtownguy
Reviews.Content: This is my first DSLR and i purchased Brand New Nikon D5100 along with Nikon 55-200mm Lens and 50mm 1.8g Lens. The pictures come out amazing. This camera is a must have for the beginners ! Can't go wrong..Five Star.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Semi-Pro Camera
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Beautiful camera that gives wonderful detailed photographs, far more detail than the typical consumer level camera.  This camera has the same sensor and processor as it's big brother the D7000.  I strongly recommend this if you want your photography to go to a "next level" but without the serious cost of a full frame Nikon.

Reviews.Title: Nikon D5100  Quality images easily obtained !
Reviews.Author: Jerry Apple
Reviews.Content: Wanted a quality camera for a begining photographer. The D-5100 is light weight, yields beautiful images printed at 11.5 x 17 inches, learning to change settings on controlls by using navigator dial on rear is quick and easy, and there is a help button on the right rear side  with quick hints. The rotating rear screen lets you aquire images at odd angles. The top of the camera does not have a settings window on the right side, but the simple push of a button opens a window with setting data on the rear screen.BOTTOM LINE: We took two of these on a recent trip, and both new photographers aquired beautiful shots.

Reviews.Title: nikon d5100 dig camera
Reviews.Author: Alan Mccartt
Reviews.Content: Camera performs well. many setting options. Most settings fairly intuitive for use. First high end digital camera. Would purchase again.

Reviews.Title: So far, so good
Reviews.Author: scgvegas "scg"
Reviews.Content: We chose this camera over the D3200 because of the HD video feature despite the slightly better reviews on the D3200.  The difference in price was minimal between the two cameras.  We used this on a short trip and, so far, are quite satisfied with what it does.  We went to Hearst Castle.  They do NOT allow flash photos PERIOD when inside the buildings and we were a little apprehensive about the results of NON flash pictures.  We worried for NO reason.  The camera compensated EXTREMELY well and we are VERY happy with the results.  I took off one star because the camera is not completely intuitive in it's operation.  As always, just like in cars, whomever designs these things COMPLETELY understands how they work but isn't necessarily in touch with the rest of us.  In its favor, it seems, at this point, that it would be a little more difficult to mess things up - so points FOR this camera.  Like everything else, as we become more accustomed to using it, we'll CERTAINLY appreciate its true potential.  This is not our first Nikon (we replaced a D50) and likely will not be our last.  We think there's enough ability in this camera to satisfy nearly anyone (amatuer to near pro) and it IS a good price.  One thing to remember though:  Just like a computer, you must tell it what you want it to do before it will do it.  Once it knows what you want, it performs very well.UPDATE #1:  Just for whatever it's worth, older Nikon DSLR lenses with auto focus may NOT work (as ours didn't).  You may want to take this into consideration . . .  Perhaps you would want to purchase new basic lenses to go with this camera.UPDATE #2:  We have also learned that, as I've read in other reviews on this camera, that the flash is a little weak compared to the D3100, D3200, and our trusty D50.  To compensate, we bought another "shorter" lens and it seems to have, mostly, resolved this issue.

Reviews.Title: Great Starter Camera!
Reviews.Author: anowling
Reviews.Content: This is a great starter camera for any photographer who wants to move from a point and shoot to a DSLR. I love this camera, the quality is great, and I have been nothing but pleased with it so far.

Reviews.Title: So much more than you pay for.
Reviews.Author: Dwegs "Dwegs"
Reviews.Content: I have not been this happy with a digital SLR purchase since the 1d Mk2 around 2004/5. It does everything that you need in an SLR, but at the price of an advanced P&S.;If it were not for professional use (high demands on a camera body for speed and durability), this would be THE Dslr for me. Swivel screen makes it fun to get low/high and compose your shots. Focusing with the center point is great, fast(ish) and accurate to a fault using the likes of a 40mm micro, and 17-55/2.8 Nikkor.The resolution is great and provides real estate that allows for detailed and beautiful prints up to around 20x30". Great set of features for this price bracket too.Get one.

Reviews.Title: Great upgrade
Reviews.Author: Marky Mark
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased the D5100 as an upgrade to the D40x I had been shooting with. I am extremely happy with the 5100. I recently did two shoots where I captured images I never could have on my D40x. The D5100 is definitely a great camera for the price.

Reviews.Title: DSLR Nikon
Reviews.Author: T. Geib
Reviews.Content: Easy to learn, love the features it can perform.  The lens' are just as simple.  Don't have to be a pro photographer to use this camera, just go out and shoot.  Light weight easy to tote.  Quality pictures without spending thousands of dollars.

Reviews.Title: Review from extremely amature photographer
Reviews.Author: Ryan F.
Reviews.Content: First off, I don't know much about photography other than what I learned from a high school photo class quite a few years back.  So take this review with a grain of salt.That being said, the quality of my pictures immediately improved when I started using my D5100.  I'm still learning about the functions, but am getting the hang of it slowly.  One thing is for sure, my photos look really good.  I do have a couple of notes for people:Camera does not come with a memory card.  You'll need to buy one separately before you can take any pictures.  You'll also need to charge the battery, which is included w/charger.Camera is way too big for use with a small Gorilla Pod.  I had one I used for my old point and shoot camera.  I was hoping it would be strong enough for both, but it wasn't even close.Auto-focus is ok, but can be a pain in the ass.  I've been using the manual focus a lot.Indoor flash is pretty sucky.  Luckily the camera is awesome and doesn't really need it as long as there is some light around.Can't wait to see what else this thing can do.  I'm really impressed with the pictures so far.

Reviews.Title: THE Choice especially if you're just getting started
Reviews.Author: cybermonk
Reviews.Content: I have read 100+ reviews of cameras and talked to aficionados of all camera types and this one (and its predecessor 3100) always ranked in the top 2. So far I am very satisfied with how user-friendly it is!

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera needing only a few improvements IMHO
Reviews.Author: Chia-Pet
Reviews.Content: I previously had a P500 which had a problem and KEH was kind enough to refund so I updated to the D5100 and glad I did. I wanted the mic input which the D5100 had for production of industrial videos. I made up a mini stereo to XLR L-R cable and can now feed the camera with a small mixer. I use transmitter lapel mics on talent which moves or requires freedom of movement. This was a biggie for me. I bought the camera with an 18-55mm lens and not real happy with the glass. I plan to buy a 35mm 1.8 in the near future for clearer shots. The sensitivity of the D5100 in low light is I think hindered by this lens and I'm hoping the 35mm 1.8 will give me the almost 2 stops better sensitivity. I recently purchased the remote and hope there is more than just a snapshot control. I would have liked a nylon 1' lens-cap lead I could easily remove with a snap release but the camera came with none. It took me a while to figure out Aftertouch features will not work with RAW snapshots unless view through lens was turned off. Would have liked the lens viewer to have full video and parameter capability but I realize the price of the camera is likely the reason it was left out. I selected Adobe raw thinking my Photoshop CS2 would then accept the pic but was sadly mistaken. I think all these new SLRs cameras should be able to produce pics with TIFF outputs so conversions are not necessary. Unfortunately versions of PS below PS3 are not upgradable. I can however use iphoto on Mac to convert easily so things are OK for me.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Camera
Reviews.Author: Alex
Reviews.Content: This camera is just fantastic. I paired it with an 18-200mm lens, and while traveling through Alaska, it was great. It is much lighter than previous generations. My favorite feature, however, has to be the flip-out screen. While it is not needed 90% of the time, the 10% of the time that I use it, it allows me to get shots I couldn't otherwise get. Although the reviews say it doesn't handle as well as the D3100, which is true, it still handles very well, and feels at home with either my huge 18-200mm lens, or my small 18-55 lens (upgraded from the 18-55, but I still have it if I want a smaller lens or better macro).

Reviews.Title: Nikon D5100 - a great DSLR value
Reviews.Author: Nikonman
Reviews.Content: I bought this from KEH as a factory-refurb and it was as if it was brand spanking new! New box, new cables, new battery, new strap, new booklet and the body was PERFECT, as described by the seller. I charged the battery overnight and began shooting the next day and haven't stopped. With my Nikon lens, it is working just great and I recommend the D5100 before I'd spend $2,000 or more on a "pro" model that won't shoot any better quality photos than the D5100. I own a D80 also and both are plenty of megapixels to achieve great photo quality.

Reviews.Title: Nikon D5100
Reviews.Author: preacher.2007
Reviews.Content: I received my camera within the time stated and I have been enjoying it ever since. I am currently taking a class to help me to take full advantage of all it's features. I am very very pleased with the the Nikon D5100.Thank you Amazon for making it happen.John

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Lina
Reviews.Content: It is what we expected .. Take very nice pictures it was a present for my dougther and now i want one for me

Reviews.Title: D5100
Reviews.Author: Dave Anand
Reviews.Content: More feature than D7000 for half the price. Hdr feature and tilt disply moniter is very handy. The seen mode makes good pic easy and fast.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: DantheMan
Reviews.Content: Camera does everything. I love it, takes awesome shots with just the kit lens though an upgrade to an 18-200 would be a good move.

Reviews.Title: Impressive
Reviews.Author: Jead
Reviews.Content: I was a little overwhelmed as a beginner with this camera at first. But after playing around with it,(and learning how to take great shots) I'm now sold. Great camera for those who want to upgrade from using cell phone camera's!

Reviews.Title: Amazing camera!
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth L. Marsh
Reviews.Content: All of my digital cameras have been point and shoots since I quit using my Olympus 35 mm camera.  This camera is totally amazing!  You don't have to be a good photographer to get wonderful shots.  I bought the 18 mm to 105 mm lens.  I am loving taking photographs again....THANK YOU NIKON for such a great camera at a reasonable price!

Reviews.Title: My new love!
Reviews.Author: DR
Reviews.Content: I have been waiting forever to buy an SLR. I finally brought myself to get one. I did a lot of research before hand and this camera met all my photo needs as a budding photographer. I reccomend it for anyone starting out that wants to upgrade from a point and shoot!

Reviews.Title: Still getting used to it
Reviews.Author: A. Gibson
Reviews.Content: I upgraded from my Nikon D200 and even though so far I am liking the D5100, it's taking a little while to get used to.  The first difference is the size and weight.  The 5100 seems so small and light.  Not necessarily bad, just different.  I can definitely say that the Auto setting works really well, and most of the exposure problems I had with the D200 have gone away.  A lot of my photos at work are just quick group shots or events and it works great. I do like some of the Effects settings as well, although I think they should be used with caution because sometimes they go a little far with sharpening and contrast and you end of fixing them in Photoshop.Most of my lenses for my D200 either do not work or have limited function with the 5100.  For a majority of my portrait work, I use the Nikon 50mm and although it works with the 5100, there is no auto focus.  But, I must say, the focus bar on the 5100 is awesome.  I thought I would end up buying a new 50mm, but I think I can do without.  I also have the Rokinon 85mm and it doesn't work at all, I'll have to upgrade.I've only had it two weeks, but I think I'm going to like it.  Just going to take a little of time to figure it all out!

Reviews.Title: A VERY excellent quality and reliable mid-range dslr!!!
Reviews.Author: Diane H
Reviews.Content: This camera boasts a slew of features that come directly from its d7000 big brother making this camera a wiser financial choice. The pictures taken a clean and precise, free of noise and distortion. The video is amazing given a proper setup. I pair my d5100 with a 55-200mm Nikkor AF VR lens, and with a stabilization rig, quality boom mic, and final cut pro x editing, im able to turn out some stunning and professional video.

Reviews.Title: Great Satisfaction
Reviews.Author: emmazai
Reviews.Content: I bought this model instead of D7000 because it is much cheaper but comes with great quality. I am completely satisfied with the picture quality, sensor, and the HD video. Apart from that, I can say that this model is easy to use for beginner like me.

Reviews.Title: First DSLR!
Reviews.Author: romerider
Reviews.Content: This Nikon is my very first dslr camera. The pictures it takes are amazing, in low light situations or not. This camera has the same sensor that the d7000 has. which we know how great of a camera that is. However when choosing my Dslr i did have trouble picking between canon or nikon. I know they both make amazing camera and lenses. i did go to the store to see how they each felt. When i did that they both were very similar (5100 vs canon t3i). so i went with the nikon based on the fact that it seems to take better photos through the research i have done. Although the canon is known to have better video mode so it a better all around camera. i highly recommend this camera to anyone wanting to get into photography and take amazing photos!

Reviews.Title: Get the firmware update to solve SD card errors.
Reviews.Author: Tom B
Reviews.Content: This isn't a review since all seems to have been said.  I love this camera but was having a lot of problems with SD card errors.  My camera was shipped from Amazon in late December.  It took amazing shots but I was ready to return it until I found the firmware update:[..]This solved all the problems I was having.  I hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: Nikon D5100
Reviews.Author: croc
Reviews.Content: I love this camera! It is easy to use and the movable display is very convenient.  I upgraded from a D80, so the video feature is great.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: David K
Reviews.Content: I bought my D5100 in September of 2011 and not from Amazon.Overall I am very pleased with its abilities and the quality of the images it produces.It came with a DVD that was very well done which has tutorials on some of the key features of the D5100. It does an excellent job in low light situations as long as the subject is not moving. I photographed our indoor bowling tournament with no flash, under available light, and the results were quite good. The HDR (High Dynamic Range)is useful and does a great job. Many of the D5100's features I have yet to explore.On the downside, the LCD screen is nearly impossible to see in direct sunlight. The continuous focus doesn't handle subjects moving from one side to the other, and the selective color effect isn't pure. The battery does not last as long as you would think. If you are photographing anything important, a second battery is a must.None of these issues are a deal breaker for me, and I would recommend getting a LCD protector and UV filters to protect the lense.I would definitely recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Good
Reviews.Author: Kurochan
Reviews.Content: Great item, received after a few weeks. But have a small problem with the card reader and the 16gb sd card. Card reader isn't working on my iMac and sometimes the SD Card gives me an error and i can't view the photos i shot on the camera, but at least i don't loose them. Other than that, VERY GOOD product. Cheers.

Reviews.Title: Nikon D5100 Great SLR for beginner
Reviews.Author: JuPu
Reviews.Content: The Nikon D5100 is a great camera for beginner photographers, wanting to explore more than point and shoot photography. Handles well, the additional book that Amazon carries that is specific for the D5100 is a great addition, giving very specific instructions on how to be more creative!

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: Kelly S. Johanssen
Reviews.Content: I upgraded from a Nikon D50 to this Nikon D5100. I went back and forth between the D7000 and the D5100. The D5100 has the same processor as the D7000 and is much cheaper. Even though it is cheaper you will not miss a thing. The quality of the pictures are amazing. The camera is very easy to use and is very simliar to other Nikon cameras so it is a smooth transition. I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for a beginner!
Reviews.Author: DoKi
Reviews.Content: I am a complete dSLR beginner.  I took an undergrad photog class in the days before dSLR, and learned the basics of SLR photography.  Of course, I have forgotten all of it, but it is all slowly coming back to me and this camera is definitely going to grow with me as I learn more about the finer points of dSLR photography.  Right off the bat, this camera took beautiful pictures.  We have a five month old baby and I was just so sick of mediocre point and shoot pics.  Literally, I unpacked the camera and within 5 minutes was taking my first pictures.  Wow are they gorgeous pics!  It's very easy to use and beginner friendly.  The battery came precharged.  It is the perfect size and weight.  It will easily travel with us and is not at all a burden to carry.  We are just so happy with this!

Reviews.Title: Good camera for little price
Reviews.Author: Heidi Lotter "MFG, Heidi"
Reviews.Content: I own the D3100 and I purchased the D5100 to have a second camera.  I use the D3100 for my telephoto lens and the D5100 for my regular lens. That was the main reason to buy it, but I also love the AEB and HDR features on the D5100.

Reviews.Title: Excellent !
Reviews.Author: Lucas
Reviews.Content: Love this camera. It's user friendly and takes terrific pictures. Haven't used the video yet  but have taken several hundred pictures with 18-55mm lens as well as zoom lens. All turn out great. The effects setting is really cool. After tons of research and almost buying a Canon T2, I found this camera does more, had better reviews and has better picture quality overall. The MP's really don't make that much difference if you don't have great lens. And this camera does. Looking for a great buy in an SLR. Buy this camera!

Reviews.Title: Great SLR at an affordable price
Reviews.Author: wbkzp
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a SLR which was not very bulky and had all the features for taking great photos. The 5100 fitted the requirement and i am happy that i bought it.Its taking great pictures, specially the low light ones at high ISO come out quite well. The HD video is also a good thing to have though the mic picks up the auto focus sound which is quite irritating. I guess an external mic would sort that. The supplied battery lasts sufficiently long.One problem that i have faced is that the memory card cover opens up quite easily. More setting buttons would have helped.

Reviews.Title: What a GREAT camera!
Reviews.Author: Steve D
Reviews.Content: I was looking for an upgrade to the digital slr world. I read the reviews on this camera and the price was great! Added the 55-300 lens with the special deal they had to save even more money! The camera works great! I have not had any problems yet or complaints. Can't wait to use it more!

Reviews.Title: Having trouble deciding which camera to buy? Read on to find out which cameras we bought and why.
Reviews.Author: CMonkey
Reviews.Content: Both the Canon t5i and the Nikon D5100 are very good and comparable cameras. Ten years ago cameras like these would have cost several THOUSANDS of dollars, so regardless of what anyone tells you, these cameras are both good and both offer what would have been professional quality and features just a few years back.We also have a D3100 and a very awesome D7100. This is the reason we stay with Nikon... the ability to share lenses and other accessories saves a lot of money. If our first camera had been a Canon or Pentax instead, we might own a bunch of Canon or Pentax cameras right now, except that Canon does not have any camera that can compete with the D7100 anywhere near that price range, and Pentax was significantly more expensive than both the Canon and Nikon cameras we were considering when we got our first camera. Canon's closest camera to the D7100 cost 3 times more than the D7100, so in that respect Nikon smashes Canon.I would have bought 2 D7100's instead of a D7100 and a D5100, but the D7100 does not have a moveable screen like the D5100 does, and that was an issue. The D7100 is a far superior camera to the D5100, so if the moveable screen is not an issue and you can afford to spend roughly double the amount of the D5100 than I would definitely recommend the D7100 over the D5100.The D5100 fills a need for us and we are happy with it. It is a very capable piece of equipment and the quality is on par with the best of the cameras in its price range.If you are having trouble deciding what brand of camera to go with, the truth of the matter is that virtually all of the big name camera companies like Pentax, Nikon, Canon and others make truly great cameras. The biggest reason why we went with Nikon is the wide range of lenses and other accessories and the prices of those items compared to other competing companies.If we could afford it, we would own cameras from all 3 of those companies, because they all make cameras that we want. But like for many other people out there, money is an issue. I had to make a decision in regards to the best balance of quality and price (for us), both now and down the road as our equipment arsenal expands. For this reason I chose Nikon.I actually plan on buying cameras from both Canon and Pentax in the future as they both have cameras that are great, and our Nikon collection will continue to grow as well with some higher end cameras as the need arises.I hope that this honest review has helped!

Reviews.Title: Camera's
Reviews.Author: Creighton
Reviews.Content: This is the best camera I have ever owned,bar none. I know there are more exspensive cameras out there, but for the money you can't go wrong with this one. It is really simple to use even if you haven't used a camera with the many features of the D5100 it is easy to learn and really fun to use.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera!
Reviews.Author: Deborah A. Deal
Reviews.Content: A former Nikon 35mm camera user, I had bought a Canon Rebel when I decided to go digital several years ago.  I have never been totally happy with my Canon, and when I read the reviews on the D5100, decided I wanted one.  This camera is awesome!  I have so much more creative control over my shooting.  The Nikon is much more light sensitive than my old Canon... and I love the folding viewing screen!  Every time I use the camera, I discover new reasons to love it.

Reviews.Title: Finally Giving Up My 35mm SLRs
Reviews.Author: John J. Faria
Reviews.Content: I've been a fairly serious hobby photographer for over thirty years.  I had a cheap point and shoot digital camera for snapshots, and a closet full of Olympus SLRs (OM1, OM2, OM4 and all kinds of lenses) for "serious" photography (not to mention a Haselblad for portraits and large prints).  I also had a closet full of film, Pan-X and Tri-X for black and white, Kodachrome and Ektachrome for slides, Kodacolor for color prints.  Then Kodak starting discontinuing films, when Kodachrome went away I knew I had to join the digital revolution.I was always an Olympus guy, due to the high quality of Zuiko lenses at a lower price than Nikon's Nikkor lenses.  Since Olympus has pretty much abandoned the Digital SLR market to Nikon and Cannon, I chose the D5100 for a few reasons.  First Nikkor lenses, and second the D5100 features the same sensor as the D7000 at a much more affordable price.I've had the D5100 with the 18-55 VR and 55-200 VR lenses for about a month.  I've taken about 500 photos, ranging from a kid's indoor birthday party to a cavern system.  I figured being a pretty decent amateur photographer I could just pick up the D5100 and snap away.  Turned out I needed to read the manual and learn the scene modes.  When I did I am amazed by the quality of photos I was able to take.  My cave photos came out as well as anything I've ever done with my OM system film cameras, and the Nikkor lenses are incredibly sharp.I'm glad I gave up 35mm and even more glad that I waited for the D5100.

Reviews.Title: My first DSLR
Reviews.Author: Pedro Gil A
Reviews.Content: After years of using the basic "point and shot" and then that earlier this year bought a Kodak Z990 (mostly to get used to the size of the device, although obviously the D5100 is much larger and heavier lol) I decided to buy it model after months of what I thought was an endless and insatiable search and comparison of equipment on the web pages that I think about photography pioneers such as DxOMark, DPReview, Snapsort, Sortable and KenRockwell.The toughest battles were fought mainly between brands Nikon and Sony, I also did important considerations for Pentax and Canon. The only Canon camera that I loved was the 60D but is very expensive for me ($ 1000), I believe that Canon is more to a professional level, that is, to dare to buy any of the 5D Mark but at a lower level other brands Nikon, Sony and Pentax are better. I liked the Pentax K-5 and K-30 mainly because they are practically immune to water, dust and extreme conditions (which gives them great advantage over other brands), but I fall on the same theme money are cameras over $ 900, and are therefore out of reach.So stay in the range of Nikon and Sony whose excellent performance at a lower price level of professionalism and superior to all other brands. I have to note that by Nikon took into account the D3200 and D5100 and by Sony A580 only (this because of information supplied by people DxOMark about the "low noise at high ISO"). The Sony A580 was out of competition due to increased price of $ 850 to over $ 900 while for example the D5100 down to $ 650, almost $ 300 less. I must report that I began to consider Sony's NEX series, especially the new NEX-F3 (the characteristic "bounce flash" and a folding screen to take you forward your own pictures was what I liked), but , also I gave up because I said to myself, for just $ 50 more would take a more serious and professional equipment like the Nikon D5100!.Anyway, I was the fight between the D5100 and D3200, this was the final battle (the hardest and most difficult of all) by the side of the D3200 had a new processor Xpeed 3, a 24MP sensor and a menu of friendly options for beginners like me. On the side of the D5100 had a 360 ° rotatable screen, a device a step up professionally and special effects systems like HDR. All this fight for a little difference of $ 50!. I finally ended up deciding for the D5100 compared to D3200 for two reasons: The screen can be rotated (helps me sometimes to take pictures of my little daughter just months old) and $ 50 less than I paid for it that were used to purchase an accessory , the SB-400 (do not forget to buy it, is very good and help a thousand times the flash with the camera by default).I hope my experience captured here will help them do.

Reviews.Title: Nikon for life.
Reviews.Author: tylerj57
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera about 8 months ago from Costco. Ive used this camera heavily. Its been through alot, and hasnt failed me yet. Turns on SUPER QUICK. Great for, well anything. Very easy to use, The camera's menu setup is great. Its a nikon product so it has hundreds of different lenses and add-ons for this, so you cant go wrong. The brand has been around forever so thats also a plus. The camera has the capability for gps yet you have to buy a 300 dollar add-on, and i like that. Gps in camera's makes no sense to me, drains battery, adds bulk, and for what, so people know where to take good pictures? Anyways, this is a great product, flash is very powerful, lcd flip out is sturdy, and it feels great in my hands.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price.
Reviews.Author: David Wilkins
Reviews.Content: This was a gift for my wife from her son and I. It was her mother's day gift and she has not stopped taking pictures. She loves the way it captures motion shots.

Reviews.Title: Pictures that will rival pictures in magazines......
Reviews.Author: H. O'Nan
Reviews.Content: I'm not a professional photographer in any means, but I was looking for a DSLR camera to make my pictures stand out on my blogs. This camera went above and beyond to impress me! I highly recommend this to anyone, whether they're a blogger, traveler, or a novice photographer looking something that is nice yet affordable to start out with.

Reviews.Title: Official Nikon Fan, Great Upgrade!
Reviews.Author: SeeYouToo "Craig"
Reviews.Content: I upgraded from the Nikon D-40 partly because I just thought it was time. 11 focusing points on this camera makes a huge difference for me. I took some great photos with the D-40 and still own it with some reluctance. Re-sell value is terrible and its to great a camera to simply give away for a measly couple of hundred bucks considering I paid almost then what I paid for this now. So with that comparison alone it makes this camera a buy. Thought about the 3100 but remembered my experience with reasons for upgrading so why not spend a few more dollars now. I couldn't afford the next level up so this is it. Honestly, I still have a ton to learn and so far this camera is superb. The thing that really has me convinced is that when I used a trial edition of adobe Lightroom 4 the actual shot photo (to me) looks better than what they are trying to change it to. Granted I still have a lot to learn but just going by what I see when I compare the photos so not sure about software too much. But my naked eye tells me there are times when there is no reason to change the tone or white balance as this camera photo looks better than the auto settings in Lightroom on most, not all, occasions. Have yet to try the video side and actually didn't buy it for the video and would have personally preferred it being a camera only with more features. But maybe I will say to myself why not mix in some video which I failed to do and was highly upset after shooting a waterfall. A 2 mintue video snip would have fit perfectly embedded within a slide show. But I was not hiking back just for video. I say buy.

Reviews.Title: Nikon D5100, LOVE IT
Reviews.Author: David V Busbee "Carpe diem quam minimum credu...
Reviews.Content: This is my first DSLR and I love it. I'm not really sure why it's labeled as a entry level DSLR. Even the basic lens it comes with is very practical.

Reviews.Title: Nice DSLR with a few trade offs
Reviews.Author: JesusFreak95
Reviews.Content: Having my 4 year old Canon XSi and lenses stolen, I was faced with a dilemma in picking a replacement.
